revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-05 18:14:24.000000000', 'message': 'Allow the user to modify the external network ips

In the 900-use-it.sh script, the user can define the gateway
(OSH_BR_EX_ADDR) and the subnet of the external network
(OSH_EXT_SUBNET). However, in the script that configures the gateway
correctly in br-ex, these values are hardcoded.

This patch allows the user to modify them by a env. variable, same as
the 900-use-it.sh script does

Change-Id: I25124024ebb72ff5fea8903fb393b71a052d0f93
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the user to modify the external network ips

In the 900-use-it.sh script, the user can define the gateway
(OSH_BR_EX_ADDR) and the subnet of the external network
(OSH_EXT_SUBNET). However, in the script that configures the gateway
correctly in br-ex, these values are hardcoded.

This patch allows the user to modify them by a env. variable, same as
the 900-use-it.sh script does

Change-Id: I25124024ebb72ff5fea8903fb393b71a052d0f93
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

'}, {'created': '2019-04-16 10:18:02.000000000', 'message': 'Remove nic method dependencies from dracclient==1.5.0

This patch removes list_nic_setting dependency from
dracclient 1.5.0 version for all stable releases from
stable/rocky to stable/queens

Change-Id: I23fa6165a542c652190c106a63beb5be98d55808
Story: 2005364
'}, {'created': '2019-05-07 13:58:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix OOB introspection to use pxe_enabled flag in idrac driver

Baremetal nodes fail to pxe boot during OpenStack deployment.
Reason of this failure is because we are not checking the
actual pxe device interface and updating the port pxe_enabled field.

This patch make sure that everytime when port is created, it checks the
the BIOS and UEFI boot modes of node and fetch the pxe device interfaces
values matching to nic id and then update the port's pxe_enabled field.

Change-Id: I23fa6165a542c652190c106a63beb5be98d55808
Story: 2005364

commit_message:
DRAC: Fix OOB introspection to use pxe_enabled flag in idrac driver

Baremetal nodes fail to pxe boot during OpenStack deployment.
Reason of this failure is because we are not checking the actual
pxe device interface and updating the port pxe_enabled field.

This patch make sure that everytime when port is created, it checks
BIOS and UEFI boot modes of node and fetch the pxe device interfaces
values matching to nic id and then update the port's pxe_enabled field.

Rocky and earlier releases do only support Python-dracclient==1.3.0 so
there are some methods like list_nic_settings etc don't exist in 1.3.0
version so I implemented list_nic_settings method in this change to
get the expected result from wsman client.


Change-Id: I2890bf16110b713e269d4a4fe410f57273dc8e83
Story: 2005364
Task: 30339
(cherry picked from commit 2b74d940c932c1bb4498f47372c0545e4480799f)

I need initiator wwn in hpe_3par_fc.py to populate initiator and connector variables.
In cinder.conf, user will specify initiator hba used to create zone. Eg. host1, host2, etc.
So, to get initiator wwn from initiator hba [in hpe_3par_common.py], there are two ways:
[1] from os_brick.initiator import linuxfc
[2] use systool command

Initially, I used os_brick code.
As per review comment on May 07th, this will not work; Also observed that unit tests got failed.

So later I used systool command; also updated unit tests & its working fine now.'}, {'account_id': 18883, 'date': '2019-05-22 04:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This makes no sense.   os-brick already populates the connector being passed in to initialize_connection with the HBA information.  That information is already available for populating the initiator_connector map needed by the zone manager.  

If multipath is disabled, you already have the HBA information.

All you have to do is create a new config option to specify which 3par nsp to use for all attachment exports.  This will require admins to use that port when manually creating zones.  This is needed for customers that do not enable the FCZM, but still need to do attachments without multipath on NSP ports that they have already zoned.'}, {'account_id': 29122, 'date': '2019-05-23 10:22:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks for your comment. Please allow me to share my understanding.

When multipath is not enabled, bootable volume is not created because of TWO reasons:
1] As mentioned in bug 1809249, from available target FC ports, first n:s:p is picked up.
2] From connector['wwpns'] array, first wwpn i.e wwpn of first initiator host is picked up.

Given below is snippet from existing code [i.e without my code changes].
hpe_3par_fc.py - def initialize_connection()

174: if not connector.get('multipath'):
175:     target_wwns = target_wwns[:1]
176:     initiator = connector.get('wwpns')[0]
177:     init_targ_map[initiator] = init_targ_map[initiator][:1]

As seen in line 177, wwpn of first initiator is used.
This is fine if first initiator hba is used for zoning [as in bug 1809249].
However, if 2nd or later initiator hba is used in zoning, then ...
appropriate wwpn [2nd or later] should be picked up [not the first one]

Same thing applies in below code as well.

hpe_3par_fc.py - def _create_host()
360: if not connector.get('multipath'):
361:     connector['wwpns'] = connector['wwpns'][:1]
  
Let me try to explain with an example.

Given below is output of command:
systool -c fc_host -v | grep -E 'Class Device|port_name'

Class Device = "host1"
  port_name           = "0x100070106f779b21"
Class Device = "host2"
  port_name           = "0x100070106f779b29"
Class Device = "host3"
  port_name           = "0x100070106f5725f1"
Class Device = "host4"
  port_name           = "0x100070106f5725f9"
Class Device = "host5"
  port_name           = "0x100070106f566729"
Class Device = "host6"
  port_name           = "0x100070106f566731"

Instead of using host1 and host2 ... suppose that host4 and host6 are used in zoning.
host4 100070106f5725f9
host6 100070106f566731

then below line picks up wwpn of host1
initiator = connector.get('wwpns')[0]

But code should ideally pick up wwpn of host4
initiator = connector.get('wwpns')[3]

To facilitate this, detail of initiator hba should also be specified by admin [in addition of target n:s:p]
Admin can specify either of following in cinder.conf:
[1] just initiator host name i.e initiator_hba=host4
OR
[2] wwpn of host4 i.e initiator_wwn=100070106f5725f9

Currently, I am following [1] i.e admin specifies initiator_hba=host4 in cinder.conf.
I understand that wwn of all initiator_hba is provided by os_brick code in connector variable.
Purpose is to get initiator_wwn from initiator_hba.
So, I am executing systool command.

If [2] is followed i.e admin specifies initiator_wwn then ...
execution of systool command is not required.
To keep things simple, should I follow this way?
And remove invocation of systool command & update code accordingly?

Let me know if I was able to get across my point of view.
Appreciate your feedback.

[Note: My sincere apologies for not providing these details earlier]'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-06-04 13:54:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The problem with this approach is you still don't know which NSP's are manually zoned by the admin.   Also, os-brick provides all the HBA information on the c-vol host when doing an attach.   You never need to issue a direct systool call.

When non multipath is used, and the deployment doesn't use the fibre channel zone manager, there is no way to tell from the driver's perspective which NSPs are zoned and can have an active attachment.  Hence the need to provide a config option to allow the admin to specify which NSP is prezoned."}, {'account_id': 29122, 'date': '2019-06-06 05:49:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thanks for the reply.
Will remove systool call and submit patchset.'}, {'account_id': 29122, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2019-06-06 10:16:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-07 12:33:56.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] 3PAR: Provide option to specify zone information for bootable volume

This fix aims to resolve below mentioned bugs:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-brick/+bug/1812665
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1809249
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1734917

Given a system connected to HPE 3PAR via FC and multipath is disabled.
When user tries to create bootable volume, it fails intermittently
with following error:
Fibre Channel volume device not found

This happens when a zone is created using second or later target from
3PAR backend.
In this case, HPE 3PAR client code picks up first initiator and first
target to form initiator target map.

To avoid above mentioned failure, user can specify host and target in
3PAR backend section of cinder.conf as follows:

hpe3par_initiator_hba = <hostxx from systool output>
hpe3par_target_nsp = <n:s:p>

This initiator and target information is read from cinder.conf and
respective wwn information is fetched.
Later initiator target map is created using wwn information and
bootable volume is created successfully.

Change-Id: If77d384afbc7097ed55a03e9b4bc7f8e1966a5c5

In this case, HPE 3PAR client code picks up first target nsp to form
initiator target map.

To avoid above mentioned failure, user can specify target nsp in 3PAR
backend section of cinder.conf as follows:

hpe3par_target_nsp = <n:s:p>

This target information is read from cinder.conf and respective
wwn information is fetched.
Later initiator target map is created using wwn information and
bootable volume is created successfully.

Change-Id: If77d384afbc7097ed55a03e9b4bc7f8e1966a5c5
Closes bug: #1809249

commit_message:
3PAR: Provide new option to specify NSP for single path attachments

This fix aims to resolve below mentioned bugs:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/os-brick/+bug/1812665
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1809249
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1734917

Given a system connected to HPE 3PAR via FC and multipath is disabled.
When user tries to create bootable volume, it fails intermittently
with following error:
Fibre Channel volume device not found

This happens when a zone is created using second or later target nsp
from 3PAR backend.
In this case, HPE 3PAR client code picks up first target nsp to form
initiator target map.

To avoid above mentioned failure, user can specify target nsp in 3PAR
backend section of cinder.conf as follows:

hpe3par_target_nsp = <n:s:p>

This target information is read from cinder.conf and respective
wwn information is fetched.
Later initiator target map is created using wwn information and
bootable volume is created successfully.

Change-Id: If77d384afbc7097ed55a03e9b4bc7f8e1966a5c5
Closes bug: #1809249

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20733, 'name': 'Rajesh Tailor', 'email': 'ratailor@redhat.com', 'username': 'rajesht'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30133, 'name': 'Piotr Kopec', 'email': 'pkopec17@gmail.com', 'username': 'pkopec'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-19 08:01:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot when using podman

There is an issue if NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot gets enabled on the
initial deploy run. It tries to start libvirt-guests in the
host_prep_tasks task. While this is not an issue with docker where we run
the libvirt-guests direct on the host (outside a container), with podman
we run the libvirt-guests inside the container and in the initial deploy
we don't have the container at this stage.

This disables to start the tripleo_nova_libvirt_guests service in the
host_prep_tasks task in case of podman is used.

Change-Id: I7569ea69399807ce2efcc6ca9403db166181a2db
Closes-Bug: #1840618
"}]
commit_message:
Fix NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot when using podman

There is an issue if NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot gets enabled on the
initial deploy run. It tries to start libvirt-guests in the
host_prep_tasks task. While this is not an issue with docker where we run
the libvirt-guests direct on the host (outside a container), with podman
we run the libvirt-guests inside the container and in the initial deploy
we don't have the container at this stage.

This disables to start the tripleo_nova_libvirt_guests service in the
host_prep_tasks task in case of podman is used.

Change-Id: I7569ea69399807ce2efcc6ca9403db166181a2db
Closes-Bug: #1840618

commit_message:
Switch to RDO Stein release on CentOS & Oracle

This change switches from the Delorean yum repositories to the RDO Stein
release repository.

centos-release-openstack-stein pulls in centos-release-ceph-nautilus,
which conflicts with upstream ceph packages. Disable the CentOS Ceph
repo to work around this.

Change-Id: I1df5dd28adc65ff461a893b60c57d7b5da96d653

[doc-contrib-guide] Remove jsoncheck

it is removed now from openstack-doc-tools, so remove it here as well.

commit_message:
Software RAID: Ignore missing component devices or holder disks

With the addition of devices with type 'MD' during
list_all_block_devices (for "empty" devices), partitions on top
of md devices are now returned as well. These don't need deletion,
so skip these during software RAID cleanup.

Story: #2006355
Task: #36121

Change-Id: Idff9b9b0cbe42b57aa315ae07c0b51c35c9ade1e

commit_message:
Exclude build request marker from server listing

When listing "real" (already in cell) instances e.g. from
nova_cell1.instances table, a marker option means "start after the
instance with marker".

For VMs:

| uuid | name |
| 1    | vm1  |
| 2    | vm2  |

"openstack server list --marker 1" returns vm2 only.

But for VMs from nova_api.build_requests table it's different.

For VMs:

| uuid | name |
| 1    | vm1  |
| 2    | vm2  |

"openstack server list --marker 1" returns both vm1 and vm2.

This patch excludes instance with marker from listing for
instances from build_requests table.

Closes-Bug: #1808286
Change-Id: I5165b69f956fbf1904112a742698b2739f747e72
(cherry picked from commit 2ef704cba619a149336692311c2614742aa32909)
(cherry picked from commit 3eb0ba988f4cfca4399c92cd6bb7b4ae8665720c)
(cherry picked from commit 8aadd4ebdfea3f1b46b2e2e62b355e8b40b6261b)

commit_message:
Adds molecule tests to image-serve and correct validation

This patch does two things:
- ensure we don't rely on systemd within the validation itself
- adds molecule tests

Since molecule tests are running in docker containers, we can't easily
use the "systemd" helpers.
This patch makes sure the validation checks if the port is opened, and
if we get a proper answer from the server.

Change-Id: Id9a1a62e0cfff0b5300af41ec6c7a08f05ddf012

commit_message:
Switch to promote jobs for api-ref/-guide

Switch publishing for api-ref and api-guide jobs to promote jobs.
Use the same file triggers for check, gate and promote jobs so that
we only promote if something was build.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676630
Change-Id: I13e9e8556bc49ae7883f52b547bf6de4941b4586

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-12 09:00:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fwaas installation under Ubuntu

In earlier releases python-neutron-fwaas was pulled in as a dependency
of neutron-common automatically, now we need to install that package
explicitly.

Note that this requires the fwaas recipe to be executed also on the
controllers, while previously it only needed to be run on the network
nodes.

Change-Id: I84659e62ae110d79eb486eef7f86869584aba4ee
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fwaas installation under Ubuntu

In earlier releases python-neutron-fwaas was pulled in as a dependency
of neutron-common automatically, now we need to install that package
explicitly.

Note that this requires the fwaas recipe to be executed also on the
controllers, while previously it only needed to be run on the network
nodes.

Change-Id: I84659e62ae110d79eb486eef7f86869584aba4ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-01 17:13:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add retry decorator update_segment_host_mapping()

When multiple agents register at the same time there is
a possible race condition causing segment host mappings
updates to fail. StaleDataError raised by SQLAlchemy ORM.

Adding retry_if_session_inactive() decorator to the method
fixes the issue.

Also serialize the method with lockutils. It takes 25+
seconds to update segment host mappings for 10 agents with
the retry decorator alone. With the method serialized the
same operation completes in less than 1 second. The retry
decorator is still required for active/active scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #1743579
Change-Id: I616457f094d000a4016c610b454be8269d9b4948
(cherry picked from commit f84781f246004651e0636f8b6507ee1e48bac6b0)
(cherry picked from commit 59520d6006ce3d6eccda25d81a5155d5328fbd96)
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry decorator update_segment_host_mapping()

When multiple agents register at the same time there is
a possible race condition causing segment host mappings
updates to fail. StaleDataError raised by SQLAlchemy ORM.

Adding retry_if_session_inactive() decorator to the method
fixes the issue.

Also serialize the method with lockutils. It takes 25+
seconds to update segment host mappings for 10 agents with
the retry decorator alone. With the method serialized the
same operation completes in less than 1 second. The retry
decorator is still required for active/active scenarios.

Closes-Bug: #1743579
Change-Id: I616457f094d000a4016c610b454be8269d9b4948
(cherry picked from commit f84781f246004651e0636f8b6507ee1e48bac6b0)
(cherry picked from commit 59520d6006ce3d6eccda25d81a5155d5328fbd96)

commit_message:
Add new method 'apply_configuration' to RAIDInterface

This commit adds new method 'apply_configuration' to RAIDInterface.
This method would be used as deploy step and would accept the
target raid config as argsinfo argument.

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
Change-Id: If50294f5413e67bb333ebba53fb3dab251f5317d
Story: 2003817
Task: 26571
Task: 30004
Task: 36061

commit_message:
fluentd: 'td-agent' embeds old <2.5 Ruby version

'activesupport' 6.0.0 requires Ruby >= 2.5.0 which is fine for those
setups where 'td-agent' is not used. But if it is used then we have
older Ruby version.

Change-Id: I9dcec3ae00b047d1d92432ae255637186de224ba

[{'created': '2019-05-20 13:58:10.000000000', 'message': 'Remove openSUSE Leap 42.3  jobs

openSUSE Leap 42.3 is going to be EOL on June 2019, so it is time
to remove jobs. Also rename the Leap 15.0 (opensuse-150) job to
Leap 15 (opensuse-15) so that we can be more easily updating this
to the opensuse-15 nodepool image (which is opensuse 15.1)

Change-Id: I01feece468b2df904b7e1d0c04e36fb7240e7f0d
'}, {'created': '2019-05-20 20:11:31.000000000', 'message': 'Remove openSUSE Leap 42.3  jobs

openSUSE Leap 42.3 is going to be EOL on June 2019, so it is time
to remove jobs. Also rename the Leap 15.0 (opensuse-150) job to
Leap 15 (opensuse-15) so that we can be more easily updating this
to the opensuse-15 nodepool image (which is opensuse 15.1)

Change-Id: I01feece468b2df904b7e1d0c04e36fb7240e7f0d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove openSUSE Leap 42.3  jobs

openSUSE Leap 42.3 is going to be EOL on June 2019, so it is time
to remove jobs. Also rename the Leap 15.0 (opensuse-150) job to
Leap 15 (opensuse-15) so that we can be more easily updating this
to the opensuse-15 nodepool image (which is opensuse 15.1)

Change-Id: I01feece468b2df904b7e1d0c04e36fb7240e7f0d

commit_message:
Initialize phys bridges before setup_rpc

Neutron-ovs-agent configures physical bridges that they works
in fail_mode=secure. This means that only packets which match some
OpenFlow rule in the bridge can be processed.
This may cause problem on hosts with only one physical NIC
where same bridge is used to provide control plane connectivity
like connection to rabbitmq and data plane connectivity for VM.
After e.g. host reboot bridge will still be in fail_mode=secure
but there will be no any OpenFlow rule on it thus there will be
no communication to rabbitmq.

With current order of actions in __init__ method of OVSNeutronAgent
class it first tries to establish connection to rabbitmq and later
configure physical bridges with some initial OpenFlow rules.
And in case described above it will fail as there is no connectivity
to rabbitmq through physical bridge.

So this patch changes order of actions in __init__ method that it first
setup physical bridges and than configure rpc connection.

Conflicts:
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Change-Id: I41c02b0164537c5b1c766feab8117cc88487bc77
Closes-Bug: #1840443
(cherry picked from commit d41bd58f31e259fe408c8c059b31299fdfe81127)
(cherry picked from commit 3a2842bdd8d8d59e445393c7c7e7a9793357df08)

commit_message:
Initialize phys bridges before setup_rpc

Neutron-ovs-agent configures physical bridges that they works
in fail_mode=secure. This means that only packets which match some
OpenFlow rule in the bridge can be processed.
This may cause problem on hosts with only one physical NIC
where same bridge is used to provide control plane connectivity
like connection to rabbitmq and data plane connectivity for VM.
After e.g. host reboot bridge will still be in fail_mode=secure
but there will be no any OpenFlow rule on it thus there will be
no communication to rabbitmq.

With current order of actions in __init__ method of OVSNeutronAgent
class it first tries to establish connection to rabbitmq and later
configure physical bridges with some initial OpenFlow rules.
And in case described above it will fail as there is no connectivity
to rabbitmq through physical bridge.

So this patch changes order of actions in __init__ method that it first
setup physical bridges and than configure rpc connection.

Change-Id: I41c02b0164537c5b1c766feab8117cc88487bc77
Closes-Bug: #1840443
(cherry picked from commit d41bd58f31e259fe408c8c059b31299fdfe81127)

We have a debian-stretch image available, run our DevStack default job
on it.

Debian no longer has a libmysqlclient-dev package as they are shipping
mariadb instead now, we can use the migration package
default-libmysqlclient-dev instead. Also it seems enough to have that
package in "general", drop its other occurrences.

Change-Id: I854d6d0e870a8c18a32353ab3fb20e440fb94969
'}]
commit_message:
Add a Debian platform job and add some fixes for it

We have a debian-stretch image available, run our DevStack default job
on it.

Debian no longer has a libmysqlclient-dev package as they are shipping
mariadb instead now, we can use the migration package
default-libmysqlclient-dev instead. Also it seems enough to have that
package in "general", drop its other occurrences.

Change-Id: I854d6d0e870a8c18a32353ab3fb20e440fb94969

commit_message:
Add devstack-tox-functional-consumer-new-neutron job

This job is based on devstack-new-neutron in order to allow shade to
consume lib/neutron for testing instead of neutron-legacy.

Change-Id: I3ed0969d950989dbec9861f75fdd11b65d502e21

commit_message:
Stop creating reproduce.sh

The script doesn't work anymore because installing zuul would require
python3 now. Instead of confusing users by providing this broken script,
stop creating it.

This may get reverted if someone finds a way to fix the script properly,
on the other hand the way forward is using native zuul v3 based jobs and
those will need a new system for reproducing anyway.

Change-Id: Ibd9c573ef311f067478a95a79da742600fc6a9d9

commit_message:
Test new neutron devstack services

Add a tempest-full-new-neutron job that uses the devstack-new-neutron
job instead of the plain devstack job. This switches the setup from
using the old lib/neutron-legacy script to the new lib/neutron script.

Change-Id: Ieddc34b28a47e816a558063af1ffa0ea36c032ff
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/552504

commit_message:
Add devstack-new-neutron job

The new job allows to test the new lib/neutron based implementation
before switching globally.

It is intended to be used mainly by neutron-consuming projects that want
to verify their implementation.

Change-Id: If5a2cb0a61a939298066087135ddf51b45e3728e

commit_message:
Complete move of neutron-fwaas tempest tests to tempest plugin

As discussed in the neutron_ci meeting [1] the QA team would like to
move the tempest tests for the stadium projects from their repos to
repos specific to being tempest plugins. This is the second part of a two
stage move, by removing the tempest tests that were copied to the
neutron-tempest-plugin repo [2].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2019/neutron_ci.2019-03-12-16.01.log.html#l-94
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron_stadium_move_to_tempest_plugin_repo

Change-Id: If97f3fd7d105f12b69d41017de2d2ed4192ac223

commit_message:
Run Validations with ThreadPoolExecutor

The validations are sequentially executed through ansible-playbook and
could take some time to complete. This patch adds support of running all
the validations in parallel through a ThreadPoolExecutor in order to
save processing time.

Without this patch, it takes almost ~5min to run all the validations but
only ~1min10 with the ThreadPoolExecutor.

- Add --worker/-w argument to give the maximum number of threads that
  can be used to execute the given validations
- Python 2.7: use futures backport instead, ThreadPoolExecutor is default
- Use six in tripleo_validator.py for python 3 compatibility

Change-Id: Ia805a556bc26700a3eb520ed72e90b37546901b8
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
CI - remove unused required-projects

openstack/requirements is not used.
openstack/kolla is used conditionally when Zuul itself adds it
due to dependency.
No need to always clone the two repositories.

Change-Id: Iabfc25e2b4227ae227f06ab196ca544b02e7808f
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'cloudkitty-tempest-full-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'cloudkitty-tempest-full-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

commit_message:
Define new 'cloudkitty-tempest-full-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'cloudkitty-tempest-full-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'cloudkitty-tempest-full-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35884

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671231/

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I214b410137e825b529f0bdc34fda74ed1df091ab

commit_message:
Use Confluent Kafka client

The change introduces the possibility to run the persister with
the new confluent-kafka client. It has to be enabled in the
configuration file.

Story: 2003705

messages:
[{'account_id': 29865, 'date': '2019-08-14 15:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-08-15 00:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-08-15 12:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-08-16 12:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29865, 'date': '2019-08-19 09:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit b59f688673d929e37cb6390d42affa466f663ee8'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 15:34:55.000000000', 'message': "Ceph-RGW HAProxy config skipped when shouldnt

Now that group ceph-rgw is in the default inventory (commit c700fdba)
the logic for haproxy_backend_nodes would always select the group
'ceph-rgw' as it will always be defined, regardless of length.

If using the ceph_rgws variable instead of the ceph-rgws group it
meant that the haproxy_backend_nodes equated to an empty group.
So the 'when' criteria in haproxy_service_config.yml did not get met
and the services config was not provisioned.

This fix checks the length of the ceph-rgws group.
If its not greater than zero, haproxy_backend_nodes is defaulted
back to ceph_rgws.

Change-Id: I7ac3e3ba9e64b38ec22704394fcd5f402dd9d7f8
"}]
commit_message:
Ceph-RGW HAProxy config skipped when shouldnt

Now that group ceph-rgw is in the default inventory (commit c700fdba)
the logic for haproxy_backend_nodes would always select the group
'ceph-rgw' as it will always be defined, regardless of length.

If using the ceph_rgws variable instead of the ceph-rgws group it
meant that the haproxy_backend_nodes equated to an empty group.
So the 'when' criteria in haproxy_service_config.yml did not get met
and the services config was not provisioned.

This fix checks the length of the ceph-rgws group.
If its not greater than zero, haproxy_backend_nodes is defaulted
back to ceph_rgws.

Change-Id: I7ac3e3ba9e64b38ec22704394fcd5f402dd9d7f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-17 07:56:02.000000000', 'message': "Force re-run of pacemaker bundle init containers during upgrade-scaleup

We need to recreate the *_init_bundle containers during the staged
upgrade (upgrade-scaleup), because the init containers will e.g. set
the correct replica count for the bundle as we're scaling up from 1 to
3 controllers.

The init containers wouldn't get re-run/recreated automatically on
upgrade-scaleup because none of their input would change. The
DeploymentIdentifier is set by the `openstack upgrade prepare` command
and applied during upgrade with `--limit controller-0`. Then later
when we run `--limit controller-0,controller-1`, the
DeploymentIdentifier value does not change from the perspective of
controller-0, so we have to explicitly remove the bundle init
containers to force re-running them.

Change-Id: I93c6d7292f37529735e24286f4076634aa4fe6a5
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit d4db2fa532c81c7c7ed13f45cb22d22ed42011bf)
"}]
commit_message:
Force re-run of pacemaker bundle init containers during upgrade-scaleup

We need to recreate the *_init_bundle containers during the staged
upgrade (upgrade-scaleup), because the init containers will e.g. set
the correct replica count for the bundle as we're scaling up from 1 to
3 controllers.

The init containers wouldn't get re-run/recreated automatically on
upgrade-scaleup because none of their input would change. The
DeploymentIdentifier is set by the `openstack upgrade prepare` command
and applied during upgrade with `--limit controller-0`. Then later
when we run `--limit controller-0,controller-1`, the
DeploymentIdentifier value does not change from the perspective of
controller-0, so we have to explicitly remove the bundle init
containers to force re-running them.

Change-Id: I93c6d7292f37529735e24286f4076634aa4fe6a5
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit d4db2fa532c81c7c7ed13f45cb22d22ed42011bf)

commit_message:
Use default BGP speaker driver in bgp_dragent.ini

In the Stein release, neutron-dynamic-routing switched from
using ryu to os-ken (a fork of ryu). The config option
bgp_speaker_driver [1] is currently set in kolla-ansible to use the ryu
driver, but this is not included in the image due to it being removed
from neutron-dynamic-routing's requirements.txt.

This change uses the os-ken driver for bgp_speaker_driver, since this
package is included in the image.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-dynamic-routing/latest/contributor/dragent-drivers.html#bgp-driver

Change-Id: I76ad84c6b963818208f080ebeb054b2553ff40af
Closes-Bug: #1839165

It would be great if there was a test for this. Doing it with gabbi won't work well as we'd need to set up some prefix (SCRIPT_NAME) handling and that's probably overkill. A unit test using a Webob.Request.blank could probably do it.

If you're not able to do that, I can take it on, let me know.

commit_message:
Make placement base API return version without auth

Allow both GET '/placement' and '/placement/' to return
version info without doing authentication.

In many deployment placement is found on a prefix of '/placement'
different servers will or will not append the '/'. To be most
resilient, accept either as "root".

A unit test is added which confirms that no auth is required
for root but auth is still required elsewhere.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Related-Bug: #1838633
Change-Id: Iaa93ec943f4f4fbb6c1af3a809859813872e62d7

commit_message:
Refactor some methods for reuse by Cyborg-related code.

scheduler/utils.py::from_extra_specs is split to reuse extra specs
parsing code for device profile parsing.

compute/manager.py::_get_hypervisor_hostname is created to get the
hostname for ARQ binding.

Change-Id: I8f0446eee26e83a85edfef09626c25e3b7d34948
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction

commit_message:
Remove nova [DEFAULT]firewall_driver option

This is no longer supported, and has been removed from the
nova-dist.conf config file in RDO.

Change-Id: I6bfaf227ed997db0f39c1ff71ca6c73c49d2f060

[{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-15 08:16:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-15 08:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-15 08:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-15 10:29:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-15 17:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-08-15 17:12:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-15 17:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-15 17:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-16 15:54:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-08-16 16:07:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

Question inline.

We could do this, but we could instead drop final:true and make this a parent job that is inherited from in openstack-zuul-jobs, which will put it next to the job that builds the docs and make it easier to keep the file matchers in sync.

We just need to make sure that the playbook itself will only work on appropriate projects (ie, if it can't find a service entry for the current project, it should fail) and that it doesn't act on anything that someone could change by adding a pre-playbook or setting a variable."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-16 16:36:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-16 16:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-08-16 16:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-16 17:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from promote-openstack-manuals to promote-docs'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-19 06:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-08-19 06:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1

i think jeblairs comments could be implemented by moving things in a follow-up, if required'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-19 06:14:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I discussed with Jim on IRC and updated the files list instead in openstack-zuul-jobs, see needed-by.'}]

commit_message:
Add promote api-ref/guide jobs

Add promote jobs for api-ref and api-guide jobs.

This adds a promote playbook since we need to calculate the service
type, for example for nova we publish to compute.

Related change: https://review.opendev.org/676624

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/676631
Change-Id: I6ca0b538b68a1dacd1144398975608f01e18d7de

Update api-ref and api-docs jobs to use the opendev-tox-docs job to be
able to use the promote pipeline as followup.

Fixing broken links

The bootswatchr host never resolves. I found this as the
new option. This may need to be confirmed by others.

Change-Id: I7694962b271b60c77c1a2846fd3cad5e02a06acd
Backport: stein rocky

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-17 17:38:58.000000000', 'message': 'Blacklist kombu-4.6.4

Commit [1] bumped the upper constraint for kombu to 4.6.4. Per issues
[2][3] this interacts poorly with eventlet and breaks many things
openstack on py37 with this error:

TypeError: open: path should be string, bytes or os.PathLike, not _NormalAccessor

It is possible there will be a simple way to fix those many things, but
in the meantime, this commit blacklists 4.6.4 to get the world moving
again.

Thanks to Daniel Leaberry for doing the legwork to identify the problem
[4].

[1] Id71496bcb5c8342851f287e35931431e8a443d23
[2] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/534
[3] https://github.com/nameko/nameko/issues/655
[4] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008553.html

Change-Id: I113c06f6e09727aa279f5ab8d2b7534a019394c2
'}, {'created': '2019-08-17 18:16:08.000000000', 'message': 'Blacklist kombu-4.6.4

Commit [1] bumped the upper constraint for kombu to 4.6.4. Per issues
[2][3] this interacts poorly with eventlet and breaks many things
openstack on py37 (including nova gate - see the linked bug) with this

TypeError: open: path should be string, bytes or os.PathLike, not _NormalAccessor

It is possible there will be a simple way to fix those many things, but

Change-Id: I113c06f6e09727aa279f5ab8d2b7534a019394c2
'}]
commit_message:
Blacklist kombu-4.6.4

Commit [1] bumped the upper constraint for kombu to 4.6.4. Per issues
[2][3] this interacts poorly with eventlet and breaks many things
openstack on py37 (including nova gate - see the linked bug) with this
error:

TypeError: open: path should be string, bytes or os.PathLike, not _NormalAccessor

I opened an issue against kombu [4].

It is possible there will be a simple way to fix those many things, but
in the meantime, this commit blacklists 4.6.4 to get the world moving
again.

Thanks to Daniel Leaberry for doing the legwork to identify the problem
[5].

Closes-Bug: #1840551

[1] Id71496bcb5c8342851f287e35931431e8a443d23
[2] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/534
[3] https://github.com/nameko/nameko/issues/655
[4] https://github.com/celery/kombu/issues/1082
[5] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008553.html

Change-Id: I113c06f6e09727aa279f5ab8d2b7534a019394c2

commit_message:
Use proxy when retrieving delorean file from RDO

If there is defined NODEPOOL_RDO_PROXY environment variable, use
it for retrieving delorean.repo file.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677088
Change-Id: Ia1fd563950acb9dca2e804d0eae03d3aa86b9261

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-10 04:42:36.000000000', 'message': "Add protection tests for trusts API

Currently, the majority of access control enforcement for the trusts API
is not done in policy, but hardcoded in the controller logic. The
default policy check strings for these routes are empty. Before we can
enable system scope and default roles through the trusts policy, we need
to replicate the existing access control in policy. To do that, we
should test how it currently works. This patch adds those tests.

The trusts API is mostly only useable by the trustor or trustee. Mostly,
admins can't perform trust actions on behalf of the trustor or trustee.
The exception is for the delete action, but only when the is_admin
context is set. This change also fixes a minor regression where the
is_admin admin could not perform this action due to the auth_context not
being populated.

Change-Id: I6a5eca8240aa905e02fbf9bec335996c3a4f1c79
Partial-bug: #1818846
Partial-bug: #1818850

commit_message:
Add protection tests for trusts API

Currently, the majority of access control enforcement for the trusts API
is not done in policy, but hardcoded in the controller logic. The
default policy check strings for these routes are empty. Before we can
enable system scope and default roles through the trusts policy, we need
to replicate the existing access control in policy. To do that, we
should test how it currently works. This patch adds those tests.

The trusts API is mostly only useable by the trustor or trustee. Mostly,
admins can't perform trust actions on behalf of the trustor or trustee.
The exception is for the delete action, but only when the is_admin
context is set. This change also fixes a minor regression where the
is_admin admin could not perform this action due to the auth_context not
being populated.

Change-Id: I6a5eca8240aa905e02fbf9bec335996c3a4f1c79
Partial-bug: #1818846
Partial-bug: #1818850

[{'created': '2019-03-21 23:04:07.000000000', 'message': 'ovs: raise RuntimeError in _get_dp if id is None

If the switch misbehaves, we may receive None from db_get_val. In this
case, int() on the return value will raise TypeError which is not
expected by callers and may result in ovs agent crash.

Instead of bubbling up the TypeError exception, we raise RuntimeError if
datapath id is None.

Change-Id: I53bea00b9a7302d694b8066e969c894bf64cb2d4
Closes-Bug: #1731494
(cherry picked from commit 38d0b2b52d7daf77cd3d5123bd2d9853fea7448f)

commit_message:
ovs: raise RuntimeError in _get_dp if id is None

If the switch misbehaves, we may receive None from db_get_val. In this
case, int() on the return value will raise TypeError which is not
expected by callers and may result in ovs agent crash.

Instead of bubbling up the TypeError exception, we raise RuntimeError if
datapath id is None.

Change-Id: I53bea00b9a7302d694b8066e969c894bf64cb2d4
Closes-Bug: #1731494
(cherry picked from commit 38d0b2b52d7daf77cd3d5123bd2d9853fea7448f)

[{'created': '2019-07-05 13:22:46.000000000', 'message': 'Start using importlib for Python 3.x

The imp module is deprecated since a while and the load_source
method has been removed from docs because broken [1][2]
Unfortunately we have to use it until Python 2.x dies, but
we can start using importlib for Python 3.3 or higher.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue14551
[2] https://mail.python.org/pipermail/python-ideas/2014-December/030265.html

Change-Id: Ic567e48b925befe2c196a5d46de8e504f273387e

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_utils.importutils to load module

The imp module is deprecated since a while and the load_source
method has been removed from docs because broken [1][2].
Switch to oslo_utils.importutils for the same.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue14551
[2] https://mail.python.org/pipermail/python-ideas/2014-December/030265.html

Change-Id: Ic567e48b925befe2c196a5d46de8e504f273387e

subject: Use list(filter) for Python 3.x (py3 fixes: 2/2)
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-17 14:44:08.000000000', 'message': 'Use list(filter) for Python 3.x (py3 fixes: 2/2)

An unit test was failed in py36-constraints because
cyborg.accelerator.drivers.fpga.intel.sysinfo.all_pfs_have_vf() returns
a list object in Python 2.x but a filter object in Python 3.x.
This patch adds list() to remove the difference.

Change-Id: Idee30e6260793b839dd93020a6f9f932cc1aea3c
Story: #2005924
Task: #34203
'}]
commit_message:
Use list(filter) for Python 3.x (py3 fixes: 2/2)

An unit test was failed in py36-constraints because
cyborg.accelerator.drivers.fpga.intel.sysinfo.all_pfs_have_vf() returns
a list object in Python 2.x but a filter object in Python 3.x.
This patch adds list() to remove the difference.

Change-Id: Idee30e6260793b839dd93020a6f9f932cc1aea3c
Story: #2005924
Task: #34203

subject: Fix CyborgObject.as_dict() for Python 3.x (py3 fixes: 1/2)
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-17 14:33:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix CyborgObject.as_dict() for Python 3.x (py3 fixes: 1/2)

An unit test was failed in py36-constraints because the behavior of hasattr()
of Python 3.x is different from one of Python 2.x. This patch replaces
hasattr(self, k) in CyboargObject.as_dict() with self.obj_attr_is_set(k).

Change-Id: Ifa8741fe5078ab02eaa95bc08df955e5f846e0f1
Story: #2005924
Task: #34203
'}]
commit_message:
Fix CyborgObject.as_dict() for Python 3.x (py3 fixes: 1/2)

An unit test was failed in py36-constraints because the behavior of hasattr()
of Python 3.x is different from one of Python 2.x. This patch replaces
hasattr(self, k) in CyboargObject.as_dict() with self.obj_attr_is_set(k).

Change-Id: Ifa8741fe5078ab02eaa95bc08df955e5f846e0f1
Story: #2005924
Task: #34203

commit_message:
Add securetty role

The securetty role will create the file `/etc/securetty` when an array
of tty's are provided.

Test Matrix:
  - default: runs through the role top to bottom with all default
             settings
  - create: runs through the role with an array of of tty's to
            ensure the role is working as expected.

Story: 2006021
Task: 34618
Task: 34620
Task: 34621
Change-Id: I6b3644cf7aa62c171172f225c25866f89830a233
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-08-18 15:46:47.000000000', 'message': 'Skip tests if glance is not available

There are some tests requiring glance service. If glance service
is not available, we want to skip those tests instead of failing
them. The following are the affected tests:
* test_commit_container
* test_run_container_with_image_driver_glance

Change-Id: Iee1f53c905863eb842535090a2bb67c3babf9b05
'}]
commit_message:
Skip tests if glance is not available

There are some tests requiring glance service. If glance service
is not available, we want to skip those tests instead of failing
them. The following are the affected tests:
* test_commit_container
* test_run_container_with_image_driver_glance

Change-Id: Iee1f53c905863eb842535090a2bb67c3babf9b05

commit_message:
Convert firewall_rules to TripleO-Ansible for deployment/(pacemaker|database)

This change converts the firewall setup to use the tripleo-ansbile
role, `tripleo-firewall`. This change combines the database and pacemaker
reviews because the "pacemaker" templates have a dependency on the
"database" templates.

Story: 2006030
Task: 36223
Task: 36246
Depends-On: Ic6d7462d82c9811e95aedf90b7a9d92700f2ebe3

Change-Id: I053698944fee5cfe8653d2bf4c7e90d76da3ea7b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-10 09:58:16.000000000', 'message': 'Clear skb mark on encapsulating packets

Looks like by default OVS tunnels inherit skb marks from
tunneled packets. As a result Neutron IPTables marks set in
qrouter namespace are inherited by VXLAN encapsulating packets.
These marks may conflict with marks used by underlying networking
(like Calico) and lead to VXLAN tunneled packets being dropped.

This patch ensures that skb marks are cleared by OVS before entering
a tunnel to avoid conflicts with IPTables rules in default namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1839252
Change-Id: Id029be51bffe4188dd7f2155db16b21d19da1698
(cherry picked from commit 762773525234814c1c47b5d21e072a30a94ff9e6)
'}]
commit_message:
Clear skb mark on encapsulating packets

Looks like by default OVS tunnels inherit skb marks from
tunneled packets. As a result Neutron IPTables marks set in
qrouter namespace are inherited by VXLAN encapsulating packets.
These marks may conflict with marks used by underlying networking
(like Calico) and lead to VXLAN tunneled packets being dropped.

This patch ensures that skb marks are cleared by OVS before entering
a tunnel to avoid conflicts with IPTables rules in default namespace.

Closes-Bug: #1839252
Change-Id: Id029be51bffe4188dd7f2155db16b21d19da1698
(cherry picked from commit 762773525234814c1c47b5d21e072a30a94ff9e6)

in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

commit_message:
[train][goal] Run 'monasca-tempest-influxdb-ipv6-only' job in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit run the new job 'monasca-tempest-influxdb-ipv6-only'
on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'monasca-tempest-influxdb-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35906

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673274/

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I53149e2da69bf089671d1ea3fd8eac0ffe9a1776

commit_message:
WIP: Use docker info instead of socat to check docker service status

This patch makes devstack installation to use docker info command
inasted of socat to check docker service status, as docker info
command should be more generic way to check service status.

Change-Id: Ia745da27ed271854979bd1b5c8fce22a322527f4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-12 07:10:39.000000000', 'message': "Update port_status to ACTIVE during live-migration

During live-migration nova waits for 'network-vif-plugged' event
in order to proceeed with live-migration [1]. While using OVN
it never happened because the original design assumes usage
of neutron agents.

This patch updates port status from DOWN to ACTIVE during
pre_live_migration state, which in fact for Neutron/ML2
is done by neutron-ovs-agent, just only to emit
'network-vif-plugged' notification and allow nova
to perform live-migration.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/558001/

Change-Id: Ib9fe6e1bfea1d5f62b2f2b6fdb12d16878108c3f
Related-Bug: 1834045
(cherry picked from commit 229f894ee6aff6b5da8cc399575537feed1c6a49)
"}]
commit_message:
Update port_status to ACTIVE during live-migration

During live-migration nova waits for 'network-vif-plugged' event
in order to proceeed with live-migration [1]. While using OVN
it never happened because the original design assumes usage
of neutron agents.

This patch updates port status from DOWN to ACTIVE during
pre_live_migration state, which in fact for Neutron/ML2
is done by neutron-ovs-agent, just only to emit
'network-vif-plugged' notification and allow nova
to perform live-migration.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/558001/

Change-Id: Ib9fe6e1bfea1d5f62b2f2b6fdb12d16878108c3f
Related-Bug: 1834045
(cherry picked from commit 229f894ee6aff6b5da8cc399575537feed1c6a49)

 > No. I'll propose them for Queen at the next meeting.
 > 
 > > Also this or another change should feature installing GridDB
 > inside the devstack environment.
 > Exactly. However, GridDB and its client libraries are not in
 > Debian/Ubuntu repos and PyPI now, so I have to make packages for
 > them.

Can't you just have a plain tarball installation ?"}, {'account_id': 659, 'date': '2017-08-21 07:14:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

>Can't you just have a plain tarball installation ?

Partially, yes.

I used a RPM for GridDB server installation. See http://www.griddb.org/griddb_nosql/manual/GridDB_RPM_InstallGuide.html.

And, I used tarballs for client libraries because no wheel/egg package for the python binding and building it requires libgridstore.a out of the c-client RPM."}, {'account_id': 659, 'date': '2017-08-21 07:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-19 12:44:19.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: add GridDB repository

Toshiba GridDB is a highly scalable distributed NoSQL database for IoT and Big Data.
See https://griddb.net/en/docs/documents/1-1_what-is-griddb.php for more details.

It has Community Edition licensed under GNU AGPL v3. The source code is available at
https://github.com/griddb/griddb_nosql .

This patchset adds a new repository driver for GridDB.

NOTE: this commit is work-in-progress:
  - No group-by argument support
  - No unit test

Change-Id: I37cf2cfb4f2b8591e231755afe80d0d231d0528d

commit_message:
Add GridDB repository

Toshiba GridDB is a highly scalable distributed NoSQL database for IoT and
big data. See https://griddb.net/en/docs/documents/1-1_what-is-griddb.php
for more details.

It has Community Edition licensed under GNU AGPL v3. The source code is
available at https://github.com/griddb/griddb_nosql .

This patchset adds a new repository driver for GridDB.

Change-Id: I37cf2cfb4f2b8591e231755afe80d0d231d0528d

commit_message:
Add GridDB repository

Toshiba GridDB is a highly scalable distributed NoSQL database for IoT and
big data.  See https://griddb.net/en/docs/documents/1-1_what-is-griddb.php
for more details.

It has Community Edition licensed under GNU AGPL v3. The source code is
available at https://github.com/griddb/griddb_nosql .

This patchset adds a new repository driver for GridDB.

Change-Id: I1652d42f4eb80a5327e1a5a2ee5153088e10260e

commit_message:
Include task_id to each command response

This patch is the prep work to have consistent api
for all sbus command, and add task_id in SBusResponse
so that we can use SBusResponse also for execution task.

Change-Id: I3df1abf42b38277e9216b4c2295a625eff05ecdb

subject: Simplify execute method in StorletDaemon
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 04:18:07.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify execute method in StorletDaemon

This patch move detailed logics for app execution from execute
method, where we have some more logics for subprocess launch,
to a sub process, so that we can easily recognize what is the
rela logics for application execution.

Change-Id: I0b1d8363eb51f3acff072165ec4edd3767078fc3
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify execute method in StorletDaemon

This patch move detailed logics for app execution from execute
method, where we have some more logics for subprocess launch,
to a sub process, so that we can easily recognize what is the
rela logics for application execution.

Change-Id: I0b1d8363eb51f3acff072165ec4edd3767078fc3

commit_message:
Create the tripleo-firewall role

This change adds the tripleo-firewall role which will serve as a general
purpose filewall configuration interface. The role will leverage iptables
and ensure a 1:1 compatibility with existing options coming from tripleo
heat templates.

Story: 2006030
Task: 34663
Task: 34665
Task: 34666
Change-Id: Ic6d7462d82c9811e95aedf90b7a9d92700f2ebe3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 18:52:11.000000000', 'message': 'Do not call update_device_list in large sets

Ovs-agent can process the ports in large sets, then all
of these ports will have to update DB status or attributes.
But neutron server is centralized. It may have to do
something else, or the database processing can be also
time-consuming. Because of these, it sometimes returns
the RPC timeout exception to ovs-agent. And a fullsync
will be triggered in next rpc loop. The restart time is
becoming longer and longer.

Adds a default step to update the port to reduce
the probability of RPC timeout.

Related-Bug: #1813703
Related-Bug: #1813704
Related-Bug: #1813706
Related-Bug: #1813707

Conflicts:
        neutron/common/constants.py
        neutron/agent/rpc.py
        neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_rpc.py

Change-Id: Ie37f4a4869969e235ce16b73cdfcbdc98626823e
(cherry picked from commit 8408af4f173a0ffde354599e26c49bf9e17e8bef)

commit_message:
Do not call update_device_list in large sets

Ovs-agent can process the ports in large sets, then all
of these ports will have to update DB status or attributes.
But neutron server is centralized. It may have to do
something else, or the database processing can be also
time-consuming. Because of these, it sometimes returns
the RPC timeout exception to ovs-agent. And a fullsync
will be triggered in next rpc loop. The restart time is
becoming longer and longer.

Adds a default step to update the port to reduce
the probability of RPC timeout.

Related-Bug: #1813703
Related-Bug: #1813704
Related-Bug: #1813706
Related-Bug: #1813707

Conflicts:
        neutron/common/constants.py
        neutron/agent/rpc.py
        neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_rpc.py

Change-Id: Ie37f4a4869969e235ce16b73cdfcbdc98626823e
(cherry picked from commit 8408af4f173a0ffde354599e26c49bf9e17e8bef)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-12 12:06:34.000000000', 'message': 'Populate binding levels when concurrent ops fail

Concurrent calls to _bind_port_if_needed may lead to a missing RPC
notification which can cause a port stuck in a DOWN state. If the only
caller that succeeds in the concurrency does not specify that an RPC
notification is allowed then no RPC would be sent to the agent. The
other caller which needs to send an RPC notification will fail since the
resulting PortContext instance will not have any binding levels set.

The failure has negative effects on consumers of the L2Population
functionality because the L2Population mechanism driver will not be
triggered to publish that a port is UP on a given compute node. Manual
intervention is required in this case.

This patch proposes to handle this by populating the PortContext with
the current binding levels so that the caller can continue on and have
an RPC notification sent out.

Closes-Bug: #1755810
Story: 2003922
Change-Id: Ie2b813b2bdf181fb3c24743dbd13487ace6ee76a
(cherry picked from commit 0dc730c7c0d3f0a49dee28d0d6e7ff9020d94443)

commit_message:
Populate binding levels when concurrent ops fail

Concurrent calls to _bind_port_if_needed may lead to a missing RPC
notification which can cause a port stuck in a DOWN state. If the only
caller that succeeds in the concurrency does not specify that an RPC
notification is allowed then no RPC would be sent to the agent. The
other caller which needs to send an RPC notification will fail since the
resulting PortContext instance will not have any binding levels set.

The failure has negative effects on consumers of the L2Population
functionality because the L2Population mechanism driver will not be
triggered to publish that a port is UP on a given compute node. Manual
intervention is required in this case.

This patch proposes to handle this by populating the PortContext with
the current binding levels so that the caller can continue on and have
an RPC notification sent out.

Closes-Bug: #1755810
Story: 2003922
Change-Id: Ie2b813b2bdf181fb3c24743dbd13487ace6ee76a
(cherry picked from commit 0dc730c7c0d3f0a49dee28d0d6e7ff9020d94443)

commit_message:
More explicitly documents ATCs & AUCs

ATCs are recognized to translators who contributed to
OpenStack official projects. User Committee recognizes translators
who contributed to user and operator code and documentation
translation [1].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/uc/2018/uc.2018-10-01-18.02.log.html

Change-Id: Iaf1780a6ae4d3e1100f8624e1c45c348166aa499

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

xstatic-jasmine already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
	setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	pbr=True)
This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ibc904ae4eaf00fe85a8c2f4dd760c081cc657ce0

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

xstatic-jquery.quicksearch already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
	 setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
   	pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Ic62e52aa5770d12b9343b7e2bea645d92383182c

(1 comment)

What's the benefit of multinode testing for Zun?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-16 14:43:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

> What's the benefit of multinode testing for Zun?

That we ensure it really works outside a single node. Docker networking is coordinated using kuryr-libnetwork and etcd cluster. It is more likely to break multinode than AIO."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-16 15:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-16 15:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

'}, {'created': '2019-08-16 15:11:09.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Zun jobs

- Test Zun on CentOS too
- Make etcd change also trigger Zun jobs (like kuryr and zun)
- Test multinode Zun deployments instead of AIO
  (more likely to break)
- In Zun scenario, stop configuring docker for legacy swarm mode
  (Zun is no swarm)
- Separate test-zun.sh testing script
- Show appcontainer to see which node it has been started on

Change-Id: I289b1009fe00aedb9b78cbd83298b14da5fd9670
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676736
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Zun jobs

- Test Zun on CentOS too
- Make etcd change also trigger Zun jobs (like kuryr and zun)
- Test multinode Zun deployments instead of AIO
  (more likely to break)
- In Zun scenario, stop configuring docker for legacy swarm mode
  (Zun is no swarm)
- Separate test-zun.sh testing script
- Show appcontainer to see which node it has been started on

Change-Id: I289b1009fe00aedb9b78cbd83298b14da5fd9670
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676736
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-08-13 12:04:54.000000000', 'message': "Force re-run of pacemaker bundle init containers during upgrade-scaleup

We need to recreate the *_init_bundle containers during the staged
upgrade (upgrade-scaleup), because the init containers will e.g. set
the correct replica count for the bundle as we're scaling up from 1 to
3 controllers.

The init containers wouldn't get re-run/recreated automatically on
upgrade-scaleup because none of their input would change. The
DeploymentIdentifier is set by the `openstack upgrade prepare` command
and applied during upgrade with `--limit controller-0`. Then later
when we run `--limit controller-0,controller-1`, the
DeploymentIdentifier value does not change from the perspective of
controller-0, so we have to explicitly remove the bundle init
containers to force re-running them.

Change-Id: I93c6d7292f37529735e24286f4076634aa4fe6a5
Partial-Bug: #1831690
"}]
commit_message:
Force re-run of pacemaker bundle init containers during upgrade-scaleup

We need to recreate the *_init_bundle containers during the staged
upgrade (upgrade-scaleup), because the init containers will e.g. set
the correct replica count for the bundle as we're scaling up from 1 to
3 controllers.

The init containers wouldn't get re-run/recreated automatically on
upgrade-scaleup because none of their input would change. The
DeploymentIdentifier is set by the `openstack upgrade prepare` command
and applied during upgrade with `--limit controller-0`. Then later
when we run `--limit controller-0,controller-1`, the
DeploymentIdentifier value does not change from the perspective of
controller-0, so we have to explicitly remove the bundle init
containers to force re-running them.

Change-Id: I93c6d7292f37529735e24286f4076634aa4fe6a5
Partial-Bug: #1831690

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 13:51:11.000000000', 'message': 'Initialize phys bridges before setup_rpc

Neutron-ovs-agent configures physical bridges that they works
in fail_mode=secure. This means that only packets which match some
OpenFlow rule in the bridge can be processed.
This may cause problem on hosts with only one physical NIC
where same bridge is used to provide control plane connectivity
like connection to rabbitmq and data plane connectivity for VM.
After e.g. host reboot bridge will still be in fail_mode=secure
but there will be no any OpenFlow rule on it thus there will be
no communication to rabbitmq.

With current order of actions in __init__ method of OVSNeutronAgent
class it first tries to establish connection to rabbitmq and later
configure physical bridges with some initial OpenFlow rules.
And in case described above it will fail as there is no connectivity
to rabbitmq through physical bridge.

So this patch changes order of actions in __init__ method that it first
setup physical bridges and than configure rpc connection.

Change-Id: I41c02b0164537c5b1c766feab8117cc88487bc77
Closes-Bug: #1840443
'}]
commit_message:
Initialize phys bridges before setup_rpc

Neutron-ovs-agent configures physical bridges that they works
in fail_mode=secure. This means that only packets which match some
OpenFlow rule in the bridge can be processed.
This may cause problem on hosts with only one physical NIC
where same bridge is used to provide control plane connectivity
like connection to rabbitmq and data plane connectivity for VM.
After e.g. host reboot bridge will still be in fail_mode=secure
but there will be no any OpenFlow rule on it thus there will be
no communication to rabbitmq.

With current order of actions in __init__ method of OVSNeutronAgent
class it first tries to establish connection to rabbitmq and later
configure physical bridges with some initial OpenFlow rules.
And in case described above it will fail as there is no connectivity
to rabbitmq through physical bridge.

So this patch changes order of actions in __init__ method that it first
setup physical bridges and than configure rpc connection.

Change-Id: I41c02b0164537c5b1c766feab8117cc88487bc77
Closes-Bug: #1840443

messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-08-08 18:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-08-17 03:57:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-08 18:22:35.000000000', 'message': 'Remove invalid dict entries from hashes.pkl

If the data in a hashes.pkl is corrupted but still de-serialized without
errors, it will mess up the replication and gets never fixed. This
happens for example if one of the keys is a NULL byte.

This patch checks if the dict keys in hashes.pkl are valid strings and
invalidates it if not.

Closes-Bug: 1830881
Change-Id: I84b062d062ff49935feed0aee3e1963bb72eb5ea
(cherry picked from commit c9e78d15e1e05f23facf7c28758b442bb25bde68)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove invalid dict entries from hashes.pkl

If the data in a hashes.pkl is corrupted but still de-serialized without
errors, it will mess up the replication and gets never fixed. This
happens for example if one of the keys is a NULL byte.

This patch checks if the dict keys in hashes.pkl are valid strings and
invalidates it if not.

Closes-Bug: 1830881
Change-Id: I84b062d062ff49935feed0aee3e1963bb72eb5ea
(cherry picked from commit c9e78d15e1e05f23facf7c28758b442bb25bde68)

commit_message:
Add stein gate test

This patchset adds the stein gate check and the changes necessary in
basic_deployment.py to get the auth to pass, as the app has changed
slightly since rocky.

Change-Id: I2dfde541ebcceb7b29a055fd75cd783e845839b5

commit_message:
Fix capitalization of project name in README

This change makes capitalization of "OpenStack" consistent with the
other reviewed OpenStack/Charm READMEs (e.g. charm-{ceph-osd,
keystone, neutron-api, openstack-dashboard, rabbitmq-server}).

Change-Id: I85382af9c9654d1b21e0b43ea59407c7c7a7061e

[{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-02-01 20:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-02-02 06:11:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

It looks nice approach but -1 because this patch doesn't close the issue completely. At least, I got 400 Bad Request with about more than 10,000 segments when call DELETE multipart-manifest=delete with this patch.

Please check my inline."}, {'account_id': 30188, 'date': '2019-03-29 21:12:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I've run into this problem as well when trying to delete an SLO with more than 10,000 parts.  The check against `MAX_BUFFERED_SLO_SEGMENTS` causes the DELETE to fail.

This patch sets the default value of `max_deletes_per_request` to infinity:
```
max_deletes_per_request=float('inf')
```
in keeping with that change, it should probably drop `MAX_BUFFERED_SLO_SEGMENTS` entirely since it is only used in that one place."}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-04-02 16:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-04-02 18:36:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 20:17:34.000000000', 'message': 'Allow bulk delete of big SLO manifests

If you set SLO's max_manifest_segments to a value larger than 10000,
then clients are able to create manifests with that many segments, but
unable to use "?multipart-manifest=delete" to delete them.

This is because the SLO middleware has its very own bulk-deleter that
it uses to handle such requests, and that bulk-deleter only allows
10000 deletions per request by default. This commit removes the
limitation so that any SLO manifest can be deleted along with its
segments.

I considered setting max-deletes-per-request to be equal to SLO's
max_manifest_segments, but that only works if max_manifest_segments
has never been decreased.

Note that this commit does not increase max_manifest_segments. Clients
cannot make SLOs any bigger than they could before. Also note that
this commit does not affect user-initiated bulk deletes, i.e. POST
requests with "?bulk-delete=true" set. Those requests are still
limited in their size, and those limits are not changed.

Change-Id: I6a35937e8418f4f2b8e29825fc9c40415e34742f
Closes-Bug: 1746685
'}, {'created': '2019-04-02 16:01:28.000000000', 'message': 'Allow bulk delete of big SLO manifests

commit_message:
Allow bulk delete of big SLO manifests

If you set SLO's max_manifest_segments to a value larger than 10000,
then clients are able to create manifests with that many segments, but
unable to use "?multipart-manifest=delete" to delete them.

This is because the SLO middleware has its very own bulk-deleter that
it uses to handle such requests, and that bulk-deleter only allows
10000 deletions per request by default. This commit removes the
limitation so that any SLO manifest can be deleted along with its
segments.

I considered setting max-deletes-per-request to be equal to SLO's
max_manifest_segments, but that only works if max_manifest_segments
has never been decreased.

Note that this commit does not increase max_manifest_segments. Clients
cannot make SLOs any bigger than they could before. Also note that
this commit does not affect user-initiated bulk deletes, i.e. POST
requests with "?bulk-delete=true" set. Those requests are still
limited in their size, and those limits are not changed.

Change-Id: I6a35937e8418f4f2b8e29825fc9c40415e34742f
Closes-Bug: 1746685

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 06:02:41.000000000', 'message': 'Initial support for tls_priorities

We add initial support for being able to specify tls priorities in
pacemaker. For bundles this will happen via an env variable because
pacemaker_remote is started normally as a process and there is no
sourcing of /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

The '-e' addition is a noop in case the PCMK_tls_priorities is unset
so that we do not change the signature of the resources and hence do
not needlessly restart the HA resource.

Depends-On: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
Change-Id: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
(cherry picked from commit f1a593b6425f1e95ef789dd8ac9e32f095e347ff)
'}]
commit_message:
Initial support for tls_priorities

We add initial support for being able to specify tls priorities in
pacemaker. For bundles this will happen via an env variable because
pacemaker_remote is started normally as a process and there is no
sourcing of /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker.

Tested on both queens and stein. Via a deploy and a redeploy against
existing cloud. Observed that:
A) We got PCMK_tls_priorities inside /etc/sysconfig/pacemaker with the
value that was passed in THT
B) Containers had the following env variable set:
  "PCMK_tls_priorities=normal",

The '-e' addition is a noop in case the PCMK_tls_priorities is unset
so that we do not change the signature of the resources and hence do
not needlessly restart the HA resource.

Depends-On: I1971810f6a90f244ed5ced972a5fe7fde29dde86
Change-Id: I703b5a429f48063474aace85bc45d948f5c91435
(cherry picked from commit f1a593b6425f1e95ef789dd8ac9e32f095e347ff)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 12:28:39.000000000', 'message': "Avoid timeout from service update api unit tests

Since If32bca070185937ef83f689b7163d965a89ec10a some of the service
update api tests are slow because setting a compute enabled or
disabled makes an RPC call to the given compute service. These tests
does not have the proper RPC setup so that call times out. The compute
api only logs an error for the timeout so the tests wasn't failing.

This patch stubs the RPC call as that is not necessary for the
api testing and therefore speeds up the tests.

Change-Id: If0960de896a67fd6bfca230b8915a45cb7af99b7
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid timeout from service update api unit tests

Since If32bca070185937ef83f689b7163d965a89ec10a some of the service
update api tests are slow because setting a compute enabled or
disabled makes an RPC call to the given compute service. These tests
does not have the proper RPC setup so that call times out. The compute
api only logs an error for the timeout so the tests wasn't failing.

This patch stubs the RPC call as that is not necessary for the
api testing and therefore speeds up the tests.

Change-Id: If0960de896a67fd6bfca230b8915a45cb7af99b7

commit_message:
Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see juju/charm-helpers#341 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: I11fb4020dc358c40bf9c1870e94186ba7e97c2db

commit_message:
Fix for enable VFIO module on boot for SR-IOV deployments

In this change [1] I've loaded wrong module. It needs the
Type1 IOMMU driver for VFIO to be loaded on boot.

[1]: I3ffd1c11a1851e62992a6a63e8abb130db82856f

Change-Id: Iba7fa6c4edea4755afb91a97460ec3cc8e7ee234
Closes-Bug: 1838159
(cherry picked from commit 8e00cef6ff2047afd7512e86753ab656edbaadd1)

commit_message:
Migrate bagpipe legacy tempest jobs to zuulv3 and py3

Introduce new zuul v3 versions of the old
legacy-tempest-dsvm-networking-bagpipe and
legacy-tempest-dsvm-networking-bgpvpn-bagpipe jobs, for modernization
and compliance with the python 3 goal.

Change-Id: I7e2b8737703060f532463bae823f99f9ecadc0df

Type1 IOMMU driver for VFIO to be loaded on boot.

[1]: I3ffd1c11a1851e62992a6a63e8abb130db82856f

[{'created': '2019-08-14 22:43:49.000000000', 'message': "Don't reveal trust existence to unauthorized users

Without this patch, any user regardless of their relation to a trust can
GET /OS-TRUST/trusts/{trust_id} and find out whether a trust with that
ID exists: if the return code is a 404, it does not exist, whereas if it
is a 403, it exists. This violates security principles and can be used
as part of a privilege escalation attack. This change ensure that the
intended access control is enforced and does not disclose the
non-existence of a trust to unauthorized users.

Since we don't use microversions and don't intend to update the major
API version, this could be read as violating the API SIG's guidelines on
API changes for interoperability[1]. However, the security impact is
severe enough that this change is warranted.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-sig/guidelines/api_interoperability.html#evaluating-api-changes

commit_message:
Don't reveal trust existence to unauthorized users

Without this patch, any user regardless of their relation to a trust can
GET /OS-TRUST/trusts/{trust_id} and find out whether a trust with that
ID exists: if the return code is a 404, it does not exist, whereas if it
is a 403, it exists. This violates security principles and can be used
as part of a privilege escalation attack. This change ensure that the
intended access control is enforced and does not disclose the
non-existence of a trust to unauthorized users.

Since we don't use microversions and don't intend to update the major
API version, this could be read as violating the API SIG's guidelines on
API changes for interoperability[1]. However, the security impact is
severe enough that this change is warranted.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-sig/guidelines/api_interoperability.html#evaluating-api-changes

Closes-bug: #1840288
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/676745

Change-Id: I669cd1675dcc3663aecf0e5882a3e53a3d77c1e0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 18:06:52.000000000', 'message': 'Use list_trusts to check for deleted trust

The keystone trusts API currently makes some flawed choices about access
control. First, there is a security issue whereby trust existence is
leaked to unauthorized users (see related bug). Second, it explicitly
prevents the admin user from retrieving a trust. In order to correct the
first issue, we need to change the keystone API to correctly return an
HTTP 403 Forbidden in the case that a trust does not exist. This impacts
tempest, which runs as the admin user, and is expecting to be able to
validate a trust deletion by checking for an HTTP 404 Not Found. We will
be able to correct the bad assumptions about the admin user by updating
the default trust policies to be aware of system scope[1] and default
roles[2]. But in all cases, the list_trusts request works properly for
the admin user and is a reliable indicator of whether a trust exists.

[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818850
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818846

Change-Id: I35d8eac972a8785b629f4cd538b521021fa33353
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/676528
Related-bug: #1840288
