HTTP 403 Forbidden in the case that a trust does not exist. This impacts
tempest, which runs as the admin user, and is expecting to be able to
validate a trust deletion by checking for an HTTP 404 Not Found. We will
be able to correct the bad assumptions about the admin user by updating
the default trust policies to be aware of system scope[1] and default
roles[2]. But in all cases, the list_trusts request works properly for
the admin user and is a reliable indicator of whether a trust exists.

[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818850
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818846

Change-Id: I35d8eac972a8785b629f4cd538b521021fa33353
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/676528
Related-bug: #1840288
'}]
commit_message:
Use list_trusts to check for deleted trust

The keystone trusts API currently makes some flawed choices about access
control. First, there is a security issue whereby trust existence is
leaked to unauthorized users (see related bug). Second, it explicitly
prevents the admin user from retrieving a trust. In order to correct the
first issue, we need to change the keystone API to correctly return an
HTTP 403 Forbidden in the case that a trust does not exist. This impacts
tempest, which runs as the admin user, and is expecting to be able to
validate a trust deletion by checking for an HTTP 404 Not Found. We will
be able to correct the bad assumptions about the admin user by updating
the default trust policies to be aware of system scope[1] and default
roles[2]. But in all cases, the list_trusts request works properly for
the admin user and is a reliable indicator of whether a trust exists.

[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818850
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1818846

Change-Id: I35d8eac972a8785b629f4cd538b521021fa33353
Needed-by: https://review.opendev.org/676528
Related-bug: #1840288

If it commits in the gate by passing, say 3.6 jobs on bionic, but then someone checks out master and runs it on 3.5 and it doesn't work, how does that help?

Some projects maintain compatibility with py35, p36, and future
py3x versions, and would like to allow devs, users, and CI
to call one target (py3).

Use of this target indicates that any Py3 will do, and there is no

interpreter version.

Change-Id: I65d58e9be4f4a5f506f96e66ff2055d04f155475

working to enable future LTS (py37) versions, and would like
to allow devs, users, and CI to call one target (py3).

Use of this target indicates that any Py3 will do, and there is no
expectation of explicitly calling tox tests/builds under a specific

Change-Id: I65d58e9be4f4a5f506f96e66ff2055d04f155475
'}]
commit_message:
Add py3 jobs with an unspecified minor version

Charm projects maintain compatibility with py35, p36, and are
working to enable future LTS (py37) versions, and would like
to allow devs, users, and CI to call one target (py3).

Use of this target indicates that any Py3 will do, and there is no
expectation of explicitly calling tox tests/builds under a specific
interpreter version.

Change-Id: I65d58e9be4f4a5f506f96e66ff2055d04f155475

subject: Fix systemd service start rate limiting
messages: [{'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2019-08-15 18:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-16 18:27:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 18:22:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix systemd service start rate limiting

The default limit is to allow 5 restarts in a 10sec period. If a
service goes over that threshold due to the Restart= config option in
the service definition, it will not attempt to restart any further.

We should not set StartLimitIntervalSec to 0 to disable any kind of
rate limiting as that may end up impacting the node load.

Instead, use tenacity to retry with an exponential backoff, when the
service unit enablement fails. Before to retry it, reset the unit's
failure counters with the systemctl wrapper. This is a crash-loop
approach that provides an efficient feature parity to the classic
rate limiting, shall we want to implement that for the systemctl
command wrapper instead.

Closes-bug: #1839841

Change-Id: I537fbf9933f2cbe6e1c2f627ba77da645bd55f25
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2eaebe2cd96aa1e121d02f6998e5addd7c52ef86)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix systemd service start rate limiting

The default limit is to allow 5 restarts in a 10sec period. If a
service goes over that threshold due to the Restart= config option in
the service definition, it will not attempt to restart any further.

We should not set StartLimitIntervalSec to 0 to disable any kind of
rate limiting as that may end up impacting the node load.

Instead, use tenacity to retry with an exponential backoff, when the
service unit enablement fails. Before to retry it, reset the unit's
failure counters with the systemctl wrapper. This is a crash-loop
approach that provides an efficient feature parity to the classic
rate limiting, shall we want to implement that for the systemctl
command wrapper instead.

Closes-bug: #1839841

Change-Id: I537fbf9933f2cbe6e1c2f627ba77da645bd55f25
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2eaebe2cd96aa1e121d02f6998e5addd7c52ef86)

commit_message:
Bump openstackdocstheme to 1.20.0

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: If67269dd4cbdb6c3b22312caf7b7f86f11ed61b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 16:51:57.000000000', 'message': "Strip prefix when paginating

The way the next URL is parsed and rebuilt in the pagination code
doesn't take a prefixed path into account like devstack uses, e.g.
/baremetal/v1/nodes. It ends up prepending the base URL and we get
/baremetal/baremetal/v1/nodes. Drop the extra prefix when building
this URL.

Change-Id: I7e46068521c40f19c1e48eedc69b4ecd862e88fc
Story: 2006216
Task: 35809

commit_message:
Strip prefix when paginating

The way the next URL is parsed and rebuilt in the pagination code
doesn't take a prefixed path into account like devstack uses, e.g.
/baremetal/v1/nodes. It ends up prepending the base URL and we get
/baremetal/baremetal/v1/nodes. Drop the extra prefix when building
this URL.

Change-Id: I7e46068521c40f19c1e48eedc69b4ecd862e88fc
Story: 2006216
Task: 35809

commit_message:
Lock volume boot pattern scenario tests

This commit adds a lock to the test_volume_boot_pattern tests. Running
these at the same time is suspected to put too much pressure on the lvm
backend and causes failures when they're run at the same time especially
on slower hardware. As a temporary stop gap to protect against that this
commit tries adding a lock to prevent the 2 tests running at the same
time.

Change-Id: I052ea70d8e47dff6c26768829beabc556e4560a0

config: remove deprecated checksum options

This patch removes the legacy code for image checksumming
as well as configuration values that are not longer being
used.

Change-Id: I9c552e33456bb862688beaabe69f2b72bb8ebcce

commit_message:
Enable overcommit_memory in test server VMs

Enable memory overcommit in server VMs to fix an allocation error when
using static binaries that have been compiled with a recent golang
toolchain (>= 1.11).

Story: 2006346
Task: 36103

Change-Id: I1e5979b4e49492c9a84f936681214deac556d856

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-05 15:02:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix libvirt driver tests to use LibvirtConfigCapsGuest instances

test_driver.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_cpu_info() and
test_driver.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_get_instance_capabilities() were
incorrectly adding LibvirtConfigGuest fixture objects to the guests
attribute of LibvirtConfigCaps, rather than LibvirtConfigCapsGuest
objects which is what the parse_dom() method of LibvirtConfigCaps
does.  LibvirtConfigCaps is intended to capture all useful information
returned by libvirt's getCapabilities API call, and
LibvirtConfigCapsGuest is intended to capture a small subset of that.
In contrast, LibvirtConfigGuest is intended for holding the entire
configuration of a libvirt guest domain.

So fix this to instead add LibvirtConfigCapsGuest fixtures.

Note that despite this bug, the tests previously passed through
duck-typing because LibvirtConfigCaps does not define __slots__ or any
other mechanism for limiting how attributes can be set on instances.

This is required by another commit in the SEV series in the near
future which will alter the fields within LibvirtConfigCapsGuest.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ic4cbbaf81938fc88980e44c4a17fe388f9c2b92b
"}, {'created': '2019-08-08 16:52:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix libvirt driver tests to use LibvirtConfigCapsGuest instances

This is required by another commit in the SEV series in the near

commit_message:
Fix libvirt driver tests to use LibvirtConfigCapsGuest instances

test_driver.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_cpu_info() and
test_driver.LibvirtConnTestCase.test_get_instance_capabilities() were
incorrectly adding LibvirtConfigGuest fixture objects to the guests
attribute of LibvirtConfigCaps, rather than LibvirtConfigCapsGuest
objects which is what the parse_dom() method of LibvirtConfigCaps
does.  LibvirtConfigCaps is intended to capture all useful information
returned by libvirt's getCapabilities API call, and
LibvirtConfigCapsGuest is intended to capture a small subset of that.
In contrast, LibvirtConfigGuest is intended for holding the entire
configuration of a libvirt guest domain.

So fix this to instead add LibvirtConfigCapsGuest fixtures.

Note that despite this bug, the tests previously passed through
duck-typing because LibvirtConfigCaps does not define __slots__ or any
other mechanism for limiting how attributes can be set on instances.

This is required by another commit in the SEV series in the near
future which will alter the fields within LibvirtConfigCapsGuest.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-08-15 18:32:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-08-16 01:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-35226 : FAILURE in 1h 48m 57s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-08-16 04:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/674628/3 : SUCCESS in 2h 34m 34s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-16 18:06:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I completely agree with Stephen that we should blow out the kwarg list instead of using **options.

I'm fine with the fact that that means we would have to keep assertXmlEqual up to scratch with XMLMatches. (Actually, it means that we would need to add a new XMLMatches kwarg to assertXmlEqual if and only if we needed to use it from assertXmlEqual. Kind of like what we're doing here.)

That said, we could also just... get rid of assertXmlEqual, for all the value it adds.

Anyway, none of this is worth dying on a hill for. This is trivial and test-only and does what you need so let's go."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-05 15:02:55.000000000', 'message': 'Allow assertXmlEqual() to pass options to matchers.XMLMatches

matchers.XMLMatches supports three options:

  - allow_mixed_nodes
  - skip_empty_text_nodes
  - skip_values

However these are not accessible when using the matcher via
assertXmlEqual().  So extend the latter with an *options
dictionary to allow options to be passed through.

This will be used by another commit in the SEV series in the near
future which needs the allow_mixed_nodes option to be enabled to
compare XML fragments with elements in different orders.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

commit_message:
Allow assertXmlEqual() to pass options to matchers.XMLMatches

matchers.XMLMatches supports three options:

  - allow_mixed_nodes
  - skip_empty_text_nodes
  - skip_values

However these are not accessible when using the matcher via
assertXmlEqual().  So extend the latter with an *options
dictionary to allow options to be passed through.

This will be used by another commit in the SEV series in the near
future which needs the allow_mixed_nodes option to be enabled to
compare XML fragments with elements in different orders.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I31c60771891c3a2eb06fbc780ba2d369465498ec

commit_message:
Fix Tempest Plugin Registry page for plugins url

There is extra 'openstack/' is added in each plugin url, for example:
- https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack/barbican-tempest-plugin
- https://opendev.org/openstack/x/trio2o

https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/plugin-registry.html

Change-Id: Idc19bedeb171a91079008e79267304158504d932

commit_message:
Add support for Ironic Networking Baremetal

Add manifests to for Ironic Networking Baremetal componentes:
 - ML2 plug-in - baremetal mechanism driver
 - L2 Agent - ironic-neutron-agent

Change-Id: I3c40f84052a41ed440758b971975c5c81ace4225
(cherry picked from commit e2beaadd52801df2cb7ecbc5f915f3b04c996722)

commit_message:
cleanup: reduce configuration vars

This patch reduces the number of configuration defaults that we
ship with no functional changes for users that were not overriding
them.

Change-Id: Iec7e7b0ca13e2503344d23095c0f1c30b46bb702

commit_message:
Install python2-networking-baremetal in neutron-server

This package contain the ML2 plug-in. Baremetal mechanism driver used
to integrate Ironic and Neutron. This is required for routed networks
support in Ironic.

Also required for routed networks support in containerized undercloud.

Change-Id: I12c36754f8da8dfb8d428ad749afca4b294ec4c4
(cherry picked from commit ae07676c674d25eb9ae0031bf2b9ec325ed86bae)

commit_message:
Add file list for promote-openstack-manuals-lang

If we do not run publishlang job in gate, there's nothing to promote -
so, add the same filelist for both gate and promote job so that we only
publish if something has changed.

Change-Id: Ifeb5f4d92c7e13d51bd2a654e1ec3c2e91f536b3

commit_message:
Handle failed nodes when enabling ssh admin

Filter server list by state before selecting by control plane address to
avoid YAQL expression issues.

Closes-Bug: #1749450
Change-Id: I0ae383105bc5d8849a733bfbe5bd61fb3fc24c66
(cherry picked from commit 3933a66c88293efc016444f04fa92b3c7c3b863a)

commit_message:
Configure Max Delay for purge job about shadow tables in nova

Recently we have a cron job to purge records in nova shadow tables.
This cron job runs on all controller nodes, but as all controllers
have configuration to run the job at the really same time, which
can result in db lock timeout or db spike.

This patch makes sure that we set a default value to Max Delay
parameter for the cron job, to avoid the problem caused by the
collision.

Change-Id: Id372ce98d8ba761ef313bd90a406737250503cab

[{'created': '2019-08-15 20:43:49.000000000', 'message': "Set notification driver to noop when enable_telemetry=false

Actually, enable_telemetry=false doesn't do anything because
the notification_drivers values are hardcoded to messaging.
This commit changes this behavior by setting notification_drivers
to noop if enable_telemetry is set to false.

Conflicts:
	elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template

Change-Id: I75441352c29b0421358fc0c87f8708355e7fbb2a
Closes-bug: #1838828
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8b6d68d13fab7cf28388d7e48f2b89be2c8932e8)
"}]
commit_message:
Set notification driver to noop when enable_telemetry=false

Actually, enable_telemetry=false doesn't do anything because
the notification_drivers values are hardcoded to messaging.
This commit changes this behavior by setting notification_drivers
to noop if enable_telemetry is set to false.

Conflicts:
	elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template

Change-Id: I75441352c29b0421358fc0c87f8708355e7fbb2a
Closes-bug: #1838828
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8b6d68d13fab7cf28388d7e48f2b89be2c8932e8)

Simplify publishdocs et al

We don't have different content for build and publish, so can cleanup
our scripts and remove any special handling.

Remove also usage of www-index.html.

Change-Id: If1a9d9a2dddbf7cdf9fd4c01d22530f2cd181907

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-02 19:40:54.000000000', 'message': 'Create tripleo container image prepare role

This change creates a role for  the tripleo heat template content for
"container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml". This change will
ensure our task process is tested using molecule and scenario tests
while also streamlining our process.

Test Matrix:
  - default - tests role using all default options
  - build - tests end to end building containers using mock data

Change-Id: Ic6e26eb95734ccf17e42e649b5e5808e1a096a78
Story: 2005985
Task: 34438
Task: 34440
Task: 34441
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

'}, {'created': '2019-08-05 17:51:05.000000000', 'message': 'Create tripleo container image prepare role

This change creates a role for  the tripleo heat template content for
"container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml". This change will
ensure our task process is tested using molecule and scenario tests
while also streamlining our process.

Test Matrix:
  - default - tests role using all default options
  - build - tests end to end building containers using mock data

A new playbook for docker vfs setup has been added. This was added to
allow some tests to run docker workloads within a local filesystem.
Without this change, docker workloads would fail because docker is
not able to run an overlayfs job from within an overlayfs
environment. This new playbook will be used within our zuul jobs
whenever the variable `docker_enable_vfs`, is set to "true".

Change-Id: Ic6e26eb95734ccf17e42e649b5e5808e1a096a78

commit_message:
Create tripleo container image prepare role

This change creates a role for  the tripleo heat template content for
"container-image-prepare-baremetal-ansible.j2.yaml". This change will
ensure our task process is tested using molecule and scenario tests
while also streamlining our process.

Test Matrix:
  - default - tests role using all default options
  - build - tests end to end building containers using mock data

A new playbook for docker vfs setup has been added. This was added to
allow some tests to run docker workloads within a local filesystem.
Without this change, docker workloads would fail because docker is
not able to run an overlayfs job from within an overlayfs
environment. This new playbook will be used within our zuul jobs
whenever the variable `docker_enable_vfs`, is set to "true".

Change-Id: Ic6e26eb95734ccf17e42e649b5e5808e1a096a78
Story: 2005985
Task: 34438
Task: 34440
Task: 34441
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see juju/charm-helpers#341 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: I2d728072bfca20e612c2d4c9178095a22f83631c

commit_message:
Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see juju/charm-helpers#341 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: Id459b11c110ef0454c665c312824791bdb2f0f38

messages: [{'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2019-08-13 11:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-15 21:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-16 13:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 11:52:29.000000000', 'message': "Check for rc instead of |succeeded

We went from `ignore_errors: true` to `failed_when: false` to prevent
Ansible printing errors which aren't really errors. When using
`succeeded` filter on a registered variable from such task, we will
always get true, which is not what we want. Check for `.rc == 0`
instead to set the facts as they were intended.

Change-Id: Ib8dea68720fda86cf4fd879cdf194d206968f6fb
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit e26009fa9c57d42a0c82ebc22169e10741005946)
"}]
commit_message:
Check for rc instead of |succeeded

We went from `ignore_errors: true` to `failed_when: false` to prevent
Ansible printing errors which aren't really errors. When using
`succeeded` filter on a registered variable from such task, we will
always get true, which is not what we want. Check for `.rc == 0`
instead to set the facts as they were intended.

Change-Id: Ib8dea68720fda86cf4fd879cdf194d206968f6fb
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit e26009fa9c57d42a0c82ebc22169e10741005946)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 09:16:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update cli docs

Initially I only wanted to update from referencing the roles ``Member``
and ``_member`` to ``member`` and ``reader``, as that are the defaults
now created by ``keystone-manage bootstrap``.

During verifying my changes I notices that some CLI output format had
changed, so I updated those too.

Finally drop listing all the IDs for creating a role assignment, as the
CLI can work with names all the way now.

Change-Id: If585a67639332bcb7e53ca4600884222978af9be
'}]
commit_message:
Update cli docs

Initially I only wanted to update from referencing the roles ``Member``
and ``_member`` to ``member`` and ``reader``, as that are the defaults
now created by ``keystone-manage bootstrap``.

During verifying my changes I notices that some CLI output format had
changed, so I updated those too.

Finally drop listing all the IDs for creating a role assignment, as the
CLI can work with names all the way now.

Change-Id: If585a67639332bcb7e53ca4600884222978af9be

commit_message:
Allow cinder coordination backend to be configured

This is to allow operator to prevent enabling redis and/or
etcd from magically configuring cinder coordinator.

Note this change is backwards-compatible.

Change-Id: Ie10be55968e43e3b9cc347b1b58771c1f7b1b910
Related-Bug: #1840070
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
tftp: start on boot & fix tftp paths

This fixes the tftp service name on CentOS and makes sure that
the service is running on boot.  It also makes sure that the
tftp_root is setup correctly for the default configuration
on CentOS.

Change-Id: I56944ea905b5ea908cf1e93d5ae1325e68788562

commit_message:
Revert "Remove explict enum-compat"

This reverts commit acfd446c03324e9fb22b2598629d79d8c0bc026a.
The workarounds discussed here are implemented in ocata/pike,
Stein and above doesn't need enum-compat. However Rocky
would still fail without this.

Change-Id: I83fe0c46cad24d9a1c64c4047429bb3491791fe5

messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-08-06 19:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-08-06 19:22:43.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1822676-rocky to bug/1822676'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-08-06 19:37:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I propose this based on the discussion in the nova channel today [1], where an operator, KeithMnemonic, has reported that there is a bug in noVNC < v1.1.0 which prevents consoles from working with ESX hypervisors. The issue is fixed in noVNC v1.1.0.

We don't yet know if a backport + stable release is possible for upstream noVNC, so I'm putting this out there in case it would be a considered a reasonable way to address the problem.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2019-08-06.log.html#t2019-08-06T15:06:33"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-08-06 19:50:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

re: noVNC upstream stable branches:

<melwitt> doesn't look promising, I don't see anything that looks like stable branches other than an old branch for v0.6 last updated 3 years ago https://github.com/novnc/noVNC"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-08-06 20:32:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Here's a link to the issue reported at noVNC:

https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/issues/1273"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-08-07 02:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/674916/1 : FAILURE in 2h 10m 10s'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-08-07 15:18:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck TIMED_OUT'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-08-07 17:22:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/674916/1 : FAILURE in 2h 02m 46s'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-08-09 17:14:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2019-08-12 10:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-08-14 00:50:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

FYI this is the issue Keith opened in the noVNC project to get some more info:

https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/issues/1273

TL;DR they don't do things like backports/stable releases like we do, so for them the fixed version is just v1.1.0.

As for why people are getting an older version, I assume it's just whatever is available from distros, for example:

https://packages.ubuntu.com/search?keywords=novnc

looks like version v0.4 in xenial, bionic, and cosmic. v1.0.0 in disco and eoan.

And I don't know how/when distro package versions ever get bumped."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-08-16 13:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-06 19:21:58.000000000', 'message': "Add 'path' query parameter to console access url

Starting in noVNC v1.1.0, the token query parameter is no longer
forwarded via cookie [1]. We must instead use the 'path' query
parameter to pass the token through to the websocketproxy [2].
This means that if someone deploys noVNC v1.1.0, VNC consoles will
break in nova because the code is relying on the cookie functionality
that v1.1.0 removed.

This modifies the ConsoleAuthToken.access_url property to include the
'path' query parameter as part of the returned access_url that the
client will use to call the console proxy service.

This change is backward compatible with noVNC < v1.1.0. The 'path' query
parameter is a long supported feature in noVNC.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1822676

 Conflicts:
	doc/source/admin/remote-console-access.rst
	nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are due to the following changes not being
in Rocky:

  I08991796aaced2abc824f608108c0c786181eb65
  I7f5f08691ca3f73073c66c29dddb996fb2c2b266

[1] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/commit/51f9f0098d306bbc67cc8e02ae547921b6f6585c
[2] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/pull/1220

Change-Id: I2ddf0f4d768b698e980594dd67206464a9cea37b
(cherry picked from commit 9606c80402f6db20d62b689c58aa8f024183628a)
(cherry picked from commit 186aff98b751b973dd5a7de9c8077b1a8bca0ba9)
"}]
commit_message:
Add 'path' query parameter to console access url

Starting in noVNC v1.1.0, the token query parameter is no longer
forwarded via cookie [1]. We must instead use the 'path' query
parameter to pass the token through to the websocketproxy [2].
This means that if someone deploys noVNC v1.1.0, VNC consoles will
break in nova because the code is relying on the cookie functionality
that v1.1.0 removed.

This modifies the ConsoleAuthToken.access_url property to include the
'path' query parameter as part of the returned access_url that the
client will use to call the console proxy service.

This change is backward compatible with noVNC < v1.1.0. The 'path' query
parameter is a long supported feature in noVNC.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1822676

 Conflicts:
	doc/source/admin/remote-console-access.rst
	nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are due to the following changes not being
in Rocky:

  I08991796aaced2abc824f608108c0c786181eb65
  I7f5f08691ca3f73073c66c29dddb996fb2c2b266

[1] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/commit/51f9f0098d306bbc67cc8e02ae547921b6f6585c
[2] https://github.com/novnc/noVNC/pull/1220

Change-Id: I2ddf0f4d768b698e980594dd67206464a9cea37b
(cherry picked from commit 9606c80402f6db20d62b689c58aa8f024183628a)
(cherry picked from commit 186aff98b751b973dd5a7de9c8077b1a8bca0ba9)

check-rdo as we're really going to want to see passing ovb before merging this"}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2018-09-29 03:20:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think it's failing because of https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1793073
~~~
2018-09-24 22:29:48.105 31620 ERROR ironic_inspector.pxe_filter.base ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
2018-09-24 22:29:48.105 31620 ERROR ironic_inspector.pxe_filter.base Command: sudo ironic-inspector-rootwrap /etc/ironic-inspector/rootwrap.conf systemctl start openstack-ironic-inspector-dnsmasq.service
2018-09-24 22:29:48.105 31620 ERROR ironic_inspector.pxe_filter.base Exit code: 99
2018-09-24 22:29:48.105 31620 ERROR ironic_inspector.pxe_filter.base Stdout: u''
2018-09-24 22:29:48.105 31620 ERROR ironic_inspector.pxe_filter.base Stderr: u'/usr/bin/ironic-inspector-rootwrap: Unauthorized command: systemctl start openstack-ironic-inspector-dnsmasq.service (no filter matched)\n'
2018-09-24 22:29:48.105 31620 ERROR ironic_inspector.pxe_filter.base 
~~~

From undercloud/etc/puppet/manifests/puppet-stack-config.pp:
~~~
# If ironic inspector is not running, mistral-db-populate will have invalid
# actions for it.                      
Class['::ironic::inspector'] ~> Exec['mistral-db-populate']  
~~~

So this could explain the failure in undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_prep_images.log.txt:
~~~
2018-09-24 22:47:15 | {u'result': u'Failed to run task [error=Failed to find action [action_name=baremetal_introspection.get_status], wf=tripleo.baremetal.v1.introspect, task=get_introspection_status]:\nTraceback (most recent call last):\n  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/engine/task_handler.py", line 63, in run_task\n    task.run()\n  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/osprofiler/profiler.py", line 158, in wrapper\n    result = f(*args, **kwargs)\n  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/engine/tasks.py", line 328, in run\n    self._run_new()\n  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/osprofiler/profiler.py", line 158, in wrapper\n    result = f(*args, **kwargs)\n  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/engine/tasks.py", line 354, in _run_new\n    self._schedule_actions()\n  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/engine/tasks.py", line 597, in _schedule_actions\n    action = self._build_action()\n  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/engine/tasks.py", line 493, in _build_action\n    self.wf_spec.get_name()\n  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/engine/actions.py", line 622, in resolve_action_definition\n    "Failed to find action [action_name=%s]" % action_spec_name\nInvalidActionException: Failed to find action [action_name=baremetal_introspection.get_status]\n'}
~~~'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2018-09-29 03:26:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

check-rdo let's try again"}, {'account_id': 16282, 'date': '2018-12-17 12:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16282, 'date': '2018-12-17 15:00:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2019-03-09 03:22:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2019-07-08 09:27:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-08-16 15:45:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines (https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html). If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out via #tripleo on freenode or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-08-16 15:45:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

If you restore this one, we need to make sure it passes ovb jobs. Also, i don't see why the 4 included patches couldn't be backported individually as well, it would make it easier to review."}]

[{'created': '2019-08-15 14:08:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add prometheus_client to monasca-agent image

The prometheus_client package is required to use the Prometheus plugin.
It makes sense to include this dependency by default since Kolla Ansible
can deploy many Prometheus exporters, making it easy to scrape their
metrics and store them in Monasca. The increase in size of the container
image is negligible.

Change-Id: I9b0a162513ed436930c4541b758fc9cb2ef97e96
(cherry picked from commit a74aa1bd21b04eceede6cf425a5e56dcacec1412)

commit_message:
Add prometheus_client to monasca-agent image

The prometheus_client package is required to use the Prometheus plugin.
It makes sense to include this dependency by default since Kolla Ansible
can deploy many Prometheus exporters, making it easy to scrape their
metrics and store them in Monasca. The increase in size of the container
image is negligible.

Change-Id: I9b0a162513ed436930c4541b758fc9cb2ef97e96
(cherry picked from commit a74aa1bd21b04eceede6cf425a5e56dcacec1412)

commit_message:
Cleanup jobs and config

Use promote jobs for all publishing jobs, they work fine.

We don't use checkbuild/checklang anymore, remove it.

Keep checkbuild job until we have renamed training-guides to use the new
job.

Change-Id: I882fd90f07987358cd55e3a04a8f7ad0c746ce80

commit_message:
Mark Storpool Driver Unsupported

The Storpool Driver 3rd Party CI hasn't
reported in over 60 days.  This does not meet the requirements
for Cinder's 3rd Party CI requirements.

As a result the driver is being marked unsupported in the
Train release and should be removed in the 'U' release if
the problems are not resolved.

Change-Id: Ia385485d41617e1be5c6b60705ee39e39832a945

commit_message:
Distribute direct charm dependencies

Do not rely on system installed Python packages but distribute the
direct charm dependencies as part of the charms wheelhouse.

As the span of distributions we need to support with reactive
charms widens we will run into compability problems with the
current model.

For further reference see juju/charm-helpers#341 and
juju-solutions/layer-basic#135

Change-Id: Ie868ed20563d3e37e19ba513ccffe575923bb9e4

commit_message:
Fix non-existent method of Mock

There is no method called_once_with() in Mock object.
Use assert_called_once_with() or assert_has_calls() instead.

Change-Id: I9f73fcbe7c3dfd64e75ac8224c13934b03443cd5
Closes-Bug: #1544522

commit_message:
add patch to make cinder-tempest-tests pass again

The behavior was changed in https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798503
which got backported to rocky, causing the tempest test to fail.

We either need to update to 0.2.0 (which is not listed as compatible
with rocky) or add the backport of the behavior change.

Change-Id: I2fab50ad9590ec0d982b61c0d6180d0dbfc085cb

commit_message:
Fix checking mongodb replication status

backport: stein, rocky

The reason it did not work before was that the other handlers had never been called
after [0], tasks from start.yml were move to handler which cannot act
like tasks, also bootstrap tasks must run after 'Restart mongodb container'.

This commit adds a notify after 'Restart mongodb container' for triger
task 'bootstrap_cluster.yml'.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/40b635b9c538e3d971f6e40db4fb3900135117e6

Change-Id: I4e2fbe9a8f20afcc4e25a01e23e5231e74eeeec4
(cherry picked from commit 6bb01bd7b1a6a8e50469ba6e606fb3689ae2f60d)

subject: [gnocchi] Don't recursively modify file perms on start
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-15 08:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-15 10:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-16 09:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 08:20:30.000000000', 'message': "[gnocchi] Don't recursively modify file perms on start

For deployments with a lot of Gnocchi data, this is a non-starter
(literally... the service basically can't start.) There maybe needs to
be a way to configure this, or only do it during deploy/bootstrap?
Unclear, but disabling for now; users can `chown -R gnocchi:gnocchi`
themselves in the meantime if need be.

Change-Id: I0bae6dfbbee9f63506c89bd6b392e7be07fd5930
(cherry picked from commit 464fefb1ef0daddd33a08f1645a5bbb8e24b98df)
"}]
commit_message:
[gnocchi] Don't recursively modify file perms on start

For deployments with a lot of Gnocchi data, this is a non-starter
(literally... the service basically can't start.) There maybe needs to
be a way to configure this, or only do it during deploy/bootstrap?
Unclear, but disabling for now; users can `chown -R gnocchi:gnocchi`
themselves in the meantime if need be.

Change-Id: I0bae6dfbbee9f63506c89bd6b392e7be07fd5930
(cherry picked from commit 464fefb1ef0daddd33a08f1645a5bbb8e24b98df)

messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-15 08:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-16 09:14:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2019-08-15 08:22:00.000000000', 'message': 'Enable iscsid on cinder-backup hosts

Without this we may see the following error in cinder-backup when using
the LVM backend:

    Could not login to any iSCSI portal

Enabling the iscsid container on hosts in the cinder-backup group fixes
this.

Closes-Bug: #1838624

Change-Id: If373c002b0744ce9dbdffed50a02bab55dd0acb9
Co-Authored-By: dmitry-a-grachev <dmitry.a.grachev@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ec075240541996f812ba39bdb84f21ddfa01d77f)
'}]
commit_message:
Enable iscsid on cinder-backup hosts

Without this we may see the following error in cinder-backup when using
the LVM backend:

    Could not login to any iSCSI portal

Enabling the iscsid container on hosts in the cinder-backup group fixes
this.

Closes-Bug: #1838624

Change-Id: If373c002b0744ce9dbdffed50a02bab55dd0acb9
Co-Authored-By: dmitry-a-grachev <dmitry.a.grachev@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit ec075240541996f812ba39bdb84f21ddfa01d77f)

* When using redis as the backend of osprofiler, it cannot connect to
redis because the redis_connection_string is incorrect.

* Let other places that use redis also use this variable.

Change-Id: I14de6597932d05cd7f804a35c6764ba4ae9087cd
Closes-Bug: #1833200
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix the redis_connection_string for osprofiler and make it generic

* When using redis as the backend of osprofiler, it cannot connect to
redis because the redis_connection_string is incorrect.

* Let other places that use redis also use this variable.

Change-Id: I14de6597932d05cd7f804a35c6764ba4ae9087cd
Closes-Bug: #1833200
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit cd836dd39f00c9a265571fc2745d9642ca72cd77)

subject: [gnocchi] Don't recursively modify file perms on start
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-15 08:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-08-15 10:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-08-16 09:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 08:20:20.000000000', 'message': "[gnocchi] Don't recursively modify file perms on start

For deployments with a lot of Gnocchi data, this is a non-starter
(literally... the service basically can't start.) There maybe needs to
be a way to configure this, or only do it during deploy/bootstrap?
Unclear, but disabling for now; users can `chown -R gnocchi:gnocchi`
themselves in the meantime if need be.

Change-Id: I0bae6dfbbee9f63506c89bd6b392e7be07fd5930
(cherry picked from commit 464fefb1ef0daddd33a08f1645a5bbb8e24b98df)
"}]
commit_message:
[gnocchi] Don't recursively modify file perms on start

For deployments with a lot of Gnocchi data, this is a non-starter
(literally... the service basically can't start.) There maybe needs to
be a way to configure this, or only do it during deploy/bootstrap?
Unclear, but disabling for now; users can `chown -R gnocchi:gnocchi`
themselves in the meantime if need be.

Change-Id: I0bae6dfbbee9f63506c89bd6b392e7be07fd5930
(cherry picked from commit 464fefb1ef0daddd33a08f1645a5bbb8e24b98df)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 08:09:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix checking mongodb replication status

backport: stein, rocky

The reason it did not work before was that the other handlers had never been called
after [0], tasks from start.yml were move to handler which cannot act
like tasks, also bootstrap tasks must run after 'Restart mongodb container'.

This commit adds a notify after 'Restart mongodb container' for triger
task 'bootstrap_cluster.yml'.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/40b635b9c538e3d971f6e40db4fb3900135117e6

Change-Id: I4e2fbe9a8f20afcc4e25a01e23e5231e74eeeec4
(cherry picked from commit 6bb01bd7b1a6a8e50469ba6e606fb3689ae2f60d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix checking mongodb replication status

backport: stein, rocky

The reason it did not work before was that the other handlers had never been called
after [0], tasks from start.yml were move to handler which cannot act
like tasks, also bootstrap tasks must run after 'Restart mongodb container'.

This commit adds a notify after 'Restart mongodb container' for triger
task 'bootstrap_cluster.yml'.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/40b635b9c538e3d971f6e40db4fb3900135117e6

Change-Id: I4e2fbe9a8f20afcc4e25a01e23e5231e74eeeec4
(cherry picked from commit 6bb01bd7b1a6a8e50469ba6e606fb3689ae2f60d)

commit_message:
Remove unused helpers in ovs_lib

1. count_flows is created in 1121807b8528590b20e1109dbdff400fccec3c38
   and never used.
2. get_ingress_bw_limit_for_dpdk_port is created in 1be857435288e4008a41fe67bbc8795dd3d8b134
   and never used.
3. get_local_port_mac is no longer used after bdfe8dcf42275f22afa457fccf188d2e3352e4a7
4. use_at_least_protocol is no longer used after cf37563c8393f964e7f390f13c43070791360cc1
5. remove_all_flows is no longer used after fcde09462da78fdc6e2fc886a164abf6fb60fefe

This is to remove them for code clean.

Change-Id: I17740053c29a1629d574a07aadb38a1522445dd9

commit_message:
Upgrade base docker image to Bionic(18.04)

This patch upgrades base docker image from Xenial(16.04)
to Bionic(18.04), so that we can use the lastest LTS for
both host and docker container images.

Change-Id: I88191a00316ecae1ce3a6ff530fc7447cf27784e

commit_message:
osc-placement 1.6.0

This library was not released since March. Libraries should be
regularly released to make their new features available to consumers.

This change was generated semi-automatically. If there is a good reason
to hold on releasing this (like if you are waiting for a specific
feature or bugfix to land before releasing), please -1 this.

Change-Id: I0ee032f305c2f8969077f995bcff4e1610346448

The tests in the patch at the start of this stack, https://review.opendev.org/676204 , are operating as a gate for the rest of the stack. They are supposed to help confirm that the changes to _merge_candidates and _satisfies_same_subtree that have happened throughout the stack have not broken things.

This change also breaks up the changes into 4 patches instead of just this one was, which was too big.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-13 18:55:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

the nested perfload job made need it's ab call adjusted:

                    Default is 30 seconds

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-14 16:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-14 17:02:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-14 17:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-14 17:40:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the analysis Eric, but I'm not clear what the next step should be.

I'm not sure if I read what you wrote correctly, either:

* the problem is present in master too
* or you were describing a theoretical case with regard to parentage  info (one obviously present in my earlier patches), one which we fix in the present stack by making sure all providers (because they come from usages) in play are in the parent data
* something else, because I'm tired, I missed"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-14 18:47:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

The problem is not present in master, since we went back to the fully-populated parentage data.

I wrote a couple of patches to prove that, in the theoretical case where we use sparse parentage data, we can break same_subtree:

unit: https://review.opendev.org/676471
gabbi: https://review.opendev.org/676477

The latter contains a test we could keep - I just need to extract it from the part that breaks it. Which I was doing when I ran across a bug in the fixture, which I've fixed here:

https://review.opendev.org/676486"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-14 19:00:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

Okay, the bit we can keep is here [1], now based on the fixture fix [2], and topped by a DNM proving that we can't do the sparse-parentage-dict thing [3].

Meanwhile, this one got a manual rebase since my last +2, revoting.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676491/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676486/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676477/"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-15 09:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-15 09:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-16 09:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-08-16 12:13:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Great detective work avoiding a potential bug!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-09 12:15:46.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates

In testing with the nested-perfload topology, containing 7000
providers, _merge_candidates was returning 21000 ProviderSummary
objects which were not trimmed until serialization processing in
handlers/allocation_candidate.py.

As we now have rw_ctx.summaries_by_id, instead of pasing around
a bunch of summary objects redundantly, we can instead pass around
ids used to access that data structure.

_alloc_candidates_multiple_providers and
_alloc_candidates_single_provider now returns keys of
rw_ctx.summaries_by_id instead of values. In neither of those methods is
a list required in either return value, so the case to list is removed.

In _merge_candidates all_psums is changed from a list to set,
removing duplicate ids on add(). At the end of the method, the
summaries which are in tree_ids are pulled from the summaries_by_id
holding area.

HOWEVER: See the FIXME added within. We're setting candidates with
too much information.

Change-Id: Ibccaed40f1eac9c244cf70654f6be1d72f7a6054
"}, {'created': '2019-08-09 15:31:37.000000000', 'message': "Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates

In testing with the nested-perfload topology, containing 7000
providers, _merge_candidates was returning 21000 ProviderSummary
objects which were not trimmed until serialization processing in
handlers/allocation_candidate.py. That situation has been present
at least since when we added same_subtree [1] so is not simply
because of the addition of rw_ctx.summaries_by_id [2]

Teasing out fixing this exposed a lot of opporutnities for
shrinking the amount of data being inspected and processed.

In no particular order the changes are:

* Return set() from _alloc_candidates_single_provider and
  _alloc_candidates_multiple_providers instead of list. It doesn't need
  to be a list and the cast to list costs.

* Because we have rw_ctx.summaries_by_id we don't need to return
  summaries from _get_by_one_request, they're in the rw_ctx.

* The candidates provided to _merge_candidates is no longer a dict of
  tuples of allocatation requests and summaries (_all_ the summaries).
  It's just a dict of allocation requests.

* _merge_candidates is updated to deal with this new structure of
  input. In the process information is looked up somewhat differently:
  we don't have summaries, but we do have the resoure providers and
  resource classes in the allocation request and the associated
  request resources

* At the end of _merge_candidates we need to winnow the contents of
  rw_ctx.summaries_by_id to only those that still matter.

* In the process of making these fixes a bug was revealed in
  _get_ancestors_by_one_uuid that wasn't noticed before because the
  parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid dict was more populated than it is now

[1] I7fdeac24606359d37f1a7405d22c5797840e1a9e
[2] I43ae1118421366336b4e96738c2981e07caebec8
Change-Id: Ibccaed40f1eac9c244cf70654f6be1d72f7a6054

"}, {'created': '2019-08-13 14:36:44.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates

In testing with the nested-perfload topology, containing 7000
providers, _merge_candidates was returning 21000 ProviderSummary
objects which were not trimmed until serialization processing in
handlers/allocation_candidate.py. That situation has been present
at least since when we added same_subtree [1] so is not simply
because of the addition of rw_ctx.summaries_by_id [2]

Teasing out fixing this exposed a lot of opporutnities for
shrinking the amount of data being inspected and processed.

In no particular order the changes are:

* Return set() from _alloc_candidates_single_provider and
  _alloc_candidates_multiple_providers instead of list. It doesn't need
  to be a list and the cast to list costs.

* Because we have rw_ctx.summaries_by_id we don't need to return
  summaries from _get_by_one_request, they're in the rw_ctx.

* The candidates provided to _merge_candidates is no longer a dict of
  tuples of allocatation requests and summaries (_all_ the summaries).
  It's just a dict of allocation requests.

* _merge_candidates is updated to deal with this new structure of
  input. In the process information is looked up somewhat differently:
  we don't have summaries, but we do have the resoure providers and
  resource classes in the allocation request and the associated
  request resources

* At the end of _merge_candidates we need to winnow the contents of
  rw_ctx.summaries_by_id to only those that still matter.

* An rw_ctx.parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid is managed and updated in
  _build_provider_summaries instead of having something local to
  _merge_candidates. This helps to avoid any doubt about whether
  or not all relevant providers have their parents recorded.

This is a WIP because it is too much lumped in one place.

[1] I7fdeac24606359d37f1a7405d22c5797840e1a9e
[2] I43ae1118421366336b4e96738c2981e07caebec8
Change-Id: Ibccaed40f1eac9c244cf70654f6be1d72f7a6054

commit_message:
Avoid duplicate ProviderSummary in _merge_candidates

In testing with the nested-perfload topology containing 7000
providers, _merge_candidates had been returning 21000 ProviderSummary
objects which were not trimmed until serialization processing in
handlers/allocation_candidate.py. That situation has been present
at least since when we added same_subtree [1] so is not simply
because of the addition of rw_ctx.summaries_by_id [2].

Teasing out fixing this exposed a lot of opportunities for
shrinking the amount of data being inspected and processed.

In no particular order the changes are:

* Return set() from _alloc_candidates_single_provider and
  _alloc_candidates_multiple_providers instead of list. It doesn't need
  to be a list and the cast to list costs.

* Because we have rw_ctx.summaries_by_id we don't need to return
  summaries from _get_by_one_request, they're in the rw_ctx.

* The candidates provided to _merge_candidates is no longer a dict of
  tuples of allocatation requests and summaries (_all_ the summaries).
  It's just a dict of allocation requests.

* At the end of _merge_candidates we need to winnow the contents of
  rw_ctx.summaries_by_id to only those that still matter.

[1] I7fdeac24606359d37f1a7405d22c5797840e1a9e
[2] I43ae1118421366336b4e96738c2981e07caebec8
Change-Id: Ibccaed40f1eac9c244cf70654f6be1d72f7a6054

commit_message:
Add missing Octavia policy file to Horizon

This commit adds the missing policy file for Octavia
in Horizon, thus enabling the panel where appropriate.

Change-Id: I60f1a52de71519f2d8bd84baa8aba5700fa75b1c
(cherry picked from commit b3d07a4b52ffc1889709826dfc8029b4891eb066)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-15 08:15:33.000000000', 'message': 'Handle more return codes from nova-status upgrade check

In a single controller scenario, the "Upgrade status check result"
does nothing because the previous task can only succeed when
`nova-status upgrade check` returns code 0. This change allows this
command to fail, so that the value of returned code stored in
`nova_upgrade_check_stdout` can then be analysed.

This change also allows for warnings (rc 1) to pass.
Closes-Bug: 1834647

Change-Id: I6f5e37832f43f23604920b9d890cc505ca924ff9
(cherry picked from commit c68ed4dd516e37844a3eb9cdd2089c985173571d)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle more return codes from nova-status upgrade check

In a single controller scenario, the "Upgrade status check result"
does nothing because the previous task can only succeed when
`nova-status upgrade check` returns code 0. This change allows this
command to fail, so that the value of returned code stored in
`nova_upgrade_check_stdout` can then be analysed.

This change also allows for warnings (rc 1) to pass.
Closes-Bug: 1834647

Change-Id: I6f5e37832f43f23604920b9d890cc505ca924ff9
(cherry picked from commit c68ed4dd516e37844a3eb9cdd2089c985173571d)

commit_message:
Change ListProjectsStaticTestJSON to not fail with many domains

Changes were made in ListProjectsStaticTestJSON in order to prevent
failure when the os_primary project is not in the default domain.
Instead of checking to see if the projects in question are both in the
default domain, check to see if they are in their respective correct
domains.

Closes-bug: #1838314
Change-Id: I5dfe04f6638657ba0b3c1f18c4bc5b5222228234

subject: Add a rw_ctx.psum_res_by_rp_rc, for clarity
messages:
[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-13 16:11:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-13 21:28:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I like this refactor, but I don't like the way we got rid of _rp_rc_key, because now we need to make sure we do the same computation in three places. That was the reason we made this (admittedly trivial) method.

For all that it's nearly identical, I would rather see _rp_rc_key accept (rp.id, rc_name) rather than (rp, rc_name).

Or we could take it a step further: make the dict private, and make methods on rw_ctx to register_psum_resource(psum_res, rp_id) and get_psum_resource(rp_id, rc_name).

But -1 to calculating the key inline in three places."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-13 21:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> Or we could take it a step further: make the dict private, and make
 > methods on rw_ctx to register_psum_resource(psum_res, rp_id) and
 > get_psum_resource(rp_id, rc_name).

Reason #1 for why I got rid of it was because I didn't want to force _consolidate_allocation_requests to make calls outside of its own model for something so trivial _and_ to create a key for a different style of dict.

Reason #2 was same thing for _build_provider_summaries, even though it was the "right" style of dict: calling elsewhere seemed too much. Which does imply your suggestion above might be worthwhile, however, see next:

Reason #3: If we're in the land of performance optimizations, method and function call overhead is non-trivial. Inlining things like key generation probably isn't going to make all that much difference, but for something where the damage isn't significant it is a reasonable thing to do.

In this case the damage isn't significant because there's really only one place where it isn't fairly clean (_build_provider_summaries) because the other two cases are either "in the class" or "a different dict with its own rules for key access that are only the same by happenstance and only used in that place (that is arrs_by_rp_rc) is local to its method, only".

Since _build_provider_summaries is still, even after all this, one of the hotbeds in this whole performance welk, I'm happy to have that little bit of duplication, via inlining, if it saves us even a tiny bit of overhead.

In the end, it would matter if we used the key in may places, but we don't.

At least, that's what I think, others may disagree, please do if you do.

The comment does need to move, so I'll fix at least that.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-13 21:52:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

FWIW, I did consider the method call overhead, and IMO it's still worthwhile. Feel free to prove me wrong with your profiley thingy, but I'm betting that's negligible next to all the object building we're doing at the same level.

Where's #define when you need it?"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-13 22:05:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> FWIW, I did consider the method call overhead, and IMO it's still
 > worthwhile. Feel free to prove me wrong with your profiley thingy,
 > but I'm betting that's negligible next to all the object building
 > we're doing at the same level.

I think you've disregarded all the rest of what I said. I can run the numbers, but that still doesn't get around the fact that it is a method for something done twice (the _consolidate one doesn't count), and only one externally, for something that is deeply internal.

That is: there's no public api here, and there's little risk.

If you want me to change it, I need to understand better what the perceived risks are."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-13 22:59:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

I'm not concerned about public API, I'm concerned about future me having to find all usages to change them, or add a new one by example.

But the magic number is three, and you've convinced me that one of those doesn't count, so I won't block on this.

But would still prefer a cleaner-looking (even if marginally less performant) solution."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-14 08:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28543, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-14 16:57:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-15 09:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-15 09:53:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-16 09:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-08-16 12:09:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 16:11:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add a rw_ctx.psum_res_by_rp_rc, for clarity

In _merge_candidates we need a final _exceeds_capacity check to
make sure a multi-part granular request has not exceeded capacity
limits. This uses a dict that maps resource provider uuid and resource
class name to a ProviderSummaryResource.

Rather than creating this dict in _merge_candidates, we now have it
as a member on the RequestWideSearchContext and add to it when
creating the ProviderSummaryResource.

This allows us to remove some looping in _merge_candidates and is
also a bit more tidy. This is only possible with the advent of
the RequestWideSearchContext, which is newer than _merge_candidates.

_exceeds_capacity is moved to the RequestWideSearchContext as
exceeds_capacity as it now makes sense as a method.

Because _rp_rc_key is now used from a few different places and with
slightly different contexts, the method is removed and callers create
their own keys.

Change-Id: Id74c01215956fc998f2dadcd9d84801ac58c2d3d
'}, {'created': '2019-08-14 08:49:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add a rw_ctx.psum_res_by_rp_rc, for clarity

In _merge_candidates we need a final _exceeds_capacity check to
make sure a multi-part granular request has not exceeded capacity
limits. This uses a dict that maps resource provider uuid and resource
class name to a ProviderSummaryResource.

Rather than creating this dict in _merge_candidates, we now have it
as a member on the RequestWideSearchContext and add to it when
creating the ProviderSummaryResource.

This allows us to remove some looping in _merge_candidates and is
also a bit more tidy. This is only possible with the advent of
the RequestWideSearchContext, which is newer than _merge_candidates.

_exceeds_capacity is moved to the RequestWideSearchContext as
exceeds_capacity as it now makes sense as a method.

Because _rp_rc_key ended up used from two different modules and for
two different purposes, the method is instead removed and callers
create their own keys directly.

Change-Id: Id74c01215956fc998f2dadcd9d84801ac58c2d3d
'}, {'created': '2019-08-14 16:57:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add a rw_ctx.psum_res_by_rp_rc, for clarity

Rather than creating this dict in _merge_candidates, we now have it
as a member on the RequestWideSearchContext and add to it when
creating the ProviderSummaryResource.

This allows us to remove some looping in _merge_candidates and is

commit_message:
Add a rw_ctx.psum_res_by_rp_rc, for clarity

In _merge_candidates we need a final _exceeds_capacity check to
make sure a multi-part granular request has not exceeded capacity
limits. This uses a dict that maps resource provider uuid and resource
class name to a ProviderSummaryResource.

Rather than creating this dict in _merge_candidates, we now have it
as a member on the RequestWideSearchContext and add to it when
creating the ProviderSummaryResource.

This allows us to remove some looping in _merge_candidates and is
also a bit more tidy. This is only possible with the advent of
the RequestWideSearchContext, which is newer than _merge_candidates.

_exceeds_capacity is moved to the RequestWideSearchContext as
exceeds_capacity as it now makes sense as a method.

Because _rp_rc_key ended up used from two different modules and for
two different purposes, the method is instead removed and callers
create their own keys directly.

Change-Id: Id74c01215956fc998f2dadcd9d84801ac58c2d3d

commit_message:
Do not require EPEL repo on RHEL-based target hosts

This change makes kolla-ansible more compatible with
RHEL which does not provide epel-release package.

EPEL was required to install simplejson from rpm
which was an ansible requirement when used python
version was below 2.5 ([1]). This has been obsolete for
quite a time so it's a good idea to get rid of it.

This change includes update of docs to read more properly.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.3/intro_installation.html

Change-Id: I825431d41fbceb824baff27130d64dabe4475d33
Signed-off-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 67cedb7ad569b19138f52fdfd353d4600bc4b2bb)

commit_message:
Use rp.id instead of uuid in _rp_rc_key

This is the tiniest of memory and hashing optimizations but is
also for subsequent changes which will change when and where a
key is create and used in the management of psum_res_by_rp_rc.

All the current callers have an rp with id set when they use this.

Change-Id: I9d8f4ed1c32deafe90cd4c4ddf7c36f11a56b6b5

[{'created': '2019-08-13 16:11:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add rw_ctx.parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid, for clarity

In _merge_candidates a dict of rp uuid to parent uuid mappings
is used to determine if providers are in the same subtree.

In this change the creation of that dict is moved from _merge_canidates
to _build_provider_summaries because we have established that all
relevant providers will be visited by the sum of calls to that method
and we do not want to have to rely on visiting all providers in
_merge_candidates, to allow for the possibility of short circuiting
some loops.

The signature on _satisfies_same_subtree is updated to accept an
rw_ctx, rather than two separate members of the object.

commit_message:
Add rw_ctx.parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid, for clarity

In _merge_candidates a dict of rp uuid to parent uuid mappings
is used to determine if providers are in the same subtree.

In this change the creation of that dict is moved from _merge_canidates
to _build_provider_summaries because we have established that all
relevant providers will be visited by the sum of calls to that method
and we do not want to have to rely on visiting all providers in
_merge_candidates, to allow for the possibility of short circuiting
some loops.

The signature on _satisfies_same_subtree is updated to accept an
rw_ctx, rather than two separate members of the object.

Change-Id: Iaba4a098847dc4a6fc1bdaee44971dd4f0e051ae

not fallback proxies. Add an option for this.

commit_message:
Use opendev-tox-docs job

Switch our docs job to use opendev-tox-docs job as base so that we can
publish later the content from gate directly (via promote queue) and do
not need to rebuild in post again.

Change-Id: If23cb919efba7253c09c5c0fb9bf10db9939cd46

[{'created': '2019-08-08 11:56:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add Swift mission into governance

Swift is one of the few projects to not have a mission.

Without this patch, it will be impossible to enforce a schema
validation on the presence of a mission.

This is a problem as we could use the mission field for
some different purposes, like o.o website.

Change-Id: I8f64b16248b3ea4dbf7a376a90a20a735b745ab3
'}]
commit_message:
Add Swift mission into governance

Swift is one of the few projects to not have a mission.

Without this patch, it will be impossible to enforce a schema
validation on the presence of a mission.

This is a problem as we could use the mission field for
some different purposes, like o.o website.

This fixes it by providing some content extracted from the
wiki of Swift.

Change-Id: I8f64b16248b3ea4dbf7a376a90a20a735b745ab3

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-16 13:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-07-16 13:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-16 14:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-07-16 15:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Can you move the changes related to the dependencies version fixes (sphinx, networkx) to a different and specific patch please, and rebase these original changes on this new patch to avoid to merge different topics together, simplify reviews, etc...

If you rebase this patch on the deps fix you will avoid CI issue too and we will keep the git history more readable.

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-07-16 15:49:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-07-16 15:52:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

Done. rebased on => Ic7f55ea7be42299cabfc4508e7ce36b23312e00d to fix  the dependency issue in a different patch.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-16 16:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

LGTM.

This patch adds all the necessary check/gate/periodic jobs that are currently missing from stable/rocky'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-07-16 19:36:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

Thoughts inline, but also see my comments on the preceding patch. I think we want to exclude the requirements job from this so we don't have to change requirements on a stable branch."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-17 11:14:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

Currently the only jobs that run in case of a patch is committed against stable/rocky are:
* test-release-openstack
* openstack-tox-lower-constraints

Maybe some others would be good, too. I don't insist any job to be part of the check/gate.

I think at least those should be there which are running on stable/queens. Otherwise it's a bit strange to have tests on stable/stein and stable/queens meanwhile they are not present on the version between them, stable/rocky."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-17 12:08:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

hmmm, I've checked stable/queens and there are the exact same jobs as in this patch:

https://github.com/openstack/taskflow/blob/stable/queens/.zuul.yaml"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-07-17 16:02:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

We must have merged the zuul patches out of order. We could probably leave everything but the requirements check in this patch to keep coverage. If we did accidentally merge a requirements change, it would get caught at release time anyway so there's relatively little danger in omitting it from a stable branch."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-18 08:56:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-07-18 09:03:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Thanks for the review Ben, I've removed the check-requirements job."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-07-18 20:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Okay, works for me. Thanks for your patience.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-08-16 11:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Also requirements need to be adjusted with global requirements due to
some packages don't support python2.7 in newer versions anymore.

Change-Id: Ic7ec3ac22e0564b0b0c97c27123bf05ad25fa7d0
Story: #2003250

commit_message:
mysql: remove grep filter workaround for logs

Since I01e6c65d18f3a1889f8aaa75e2e6f68175bbc608 was landed, we don't
need the workaround which pulled out some logs we didn't want to parse.

Change-Id: Ibee22da33391a5e67de02fe08c634a887c9bfa69
Related-Bug: #1811384

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 14:17:28.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add gabbits using a DeepNUMANetworkFixture

Modify the NUMANetworkFixture so we make a subclass
that pre-creates cn1 and cn2 and puts them under distinct parents and a
shared grandparent. This helps to model a deeply nested but sparse
topology where providers that contribute to the solution are low down
in the tree.

This is a WIP because I've gotten myself confused if this is providing
a test of the functionality we want to test as described in Eric's
comment at [1]. I've been messing with it for so long, untangling my
confusion, that I've lost track of myself. Rather than beating myself
up, I'll post to get some feedback and ask for help. The idea is to
have this test in place prior to [2] so we can be sure it doesn't break
this when manipulating the same_subtree handling. However, in order for
that to work, the test has to be complete and I'm pretty sure this is
not, or rather I have no confidence that it  is.

The added gabbit intentionally uses yaml anchors to indicate that the
expected response on each test is the same.

Understanding the structure of the available resource providers and
the UUIDs in use can be super painful, but osc_placement_tree [3] can
help. I added the following to the end of make_entities to trigger it
to dump:

        from osc_placement_tree import utils as placement_visual
        from placement import direct
        import time

        with direct.PlacementDirect(
              self.conf_fixture.conf, latest_microversion=True) as client:
            placement_visual.dump_placement_db_to_dot(
                    placement_visual.PlacementDirectAsClientWrapper(client),
                    '/tmp/dump.%s.dot' % time.time(),
                    hidden_fields=['inventories', 'generation', 'aggregates', 'resource_provider_generation'])

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675606/2/placement/objects/allocation_candidate.py@908
[2] Ibccaed40f1eac9c244cf70654f6be1d72f7a6054
[3] https://pypi.org/project/osc-placement-tree/

Change-Id: I2aedac0ce3a4f5a40de796bb9f74824541a95a65

commit_message:
Add gabbits using a DeepNUMANetworkFixture

Modify the NUMANetworkFixture so we make a subclass
that pre-creates cn1 and cn2 and puts them under distinct parents and a
shared grandparent. This helps to model a deeply nested but sparse
topology where providers that contribute to the solution are low down
in the tree.

This provides a deeper topology to test the same_subtree and
_merge_candidates changes that come in the following patches.

The added gabbit intentionally uses yaml anchors to indicate that the
expected response on each test is the same.

Understanding the structure of the available resource providers and
the UUIDs in use can be super painful, but osc_placement_tree [1] can
help. In my own tetsing I added the following to the end of
make_entities to trigger it to dump:

        from osc_placement_tree import utils as placement_visual
        from placement import direct
        import time

        with direct.PlacementDirect(
              self.conf_fixture.conf, latest_microversion=True) as client:
            placement_visual.dump_placement_db_to_dot(
                    placement_visual.PlacementDirectAsClientWrapper(client),
                    '/tmp/dump.%s.dot' % time.time(),
                    hidden_fields=['inventories', 'generation', 'aggregates', 'resource_provider_generation'])

[1] https://pypi.org/project/osc-placement-tree/

Change-Id: I2aedac0ce3a4f5a40de796bb9f74824541a95a65

subject: [train][goal] Define new 'sahara-tests-tempest-v2-ipv6-only' job
messages: [{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-16 10:58:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 10:58:59.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new 'sahara-tests-tempest-v2-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will deploy
services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'sahara-tests-tempest-v2-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'sahara-tests-tempest-v2-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Change-Id: Idcb25b503e588df6cdbb2addfb7ad0a4cc40fabf
Story: #2005477
Task: #35927
"}]
commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'sahara-tests-tempest-v2-ipv6-only' job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will deploy
services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'sahara-tests-tempest-v2-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'sahara-tests-tempest-v2-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Change-Id: Idcb25b503e588df6cdbb2addfb7ad0a4cc40fabf
Story: #2005477
Task: #35927

ancestry data when calculating same_subtree-ness. This commit introduces

commit_message:
gabbi test for same_subtree with an ancestry hole

Based on the analysis at [1], we need to continue to use fully-populated
ancestry data when calculating same_subtree-ness. This commit introduces
a gabbi test that covers a particular case that can be broken if we
don't do that: where a provider involved in the request has a broken
ancestry path to another provider involved in the request.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675606/2/placement/objects/allocation_candidate.py@908

Change-Id: I5062e725d6f29cd997b974a0dad7dc4d0ed2900f

(5 comments)

This looks sane, though I'm out of my element enough to avoid +2ing.

Just one thing I noticed, it seems like there would be a (rare, but possible) race between this event and the periodic that would force the state change (the thing we're trying to avoid).

[Later] Indeed, I see this came up in the spec [1]. So are we missing the lock mentioned there? Or did we decide it wasn't worth it? I feel like there should at least be a NOTE or TODO about it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/636132/7/specs/train/approved/nova-support-instance-power-update.rst@72"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-23 15:39:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
API microversion 2.76: Add 'power-update' external event

This patch adds a new external event called "power-update"
through which ironic will convey all (power_off and power_on)
power state changes (running -> shutdown or shutdown -> running
will be the only ones handled by nova and the rest will be ignored)
on a physical instance to nova. The database will be updated
accordingly to reflect the real vm_state and power_state of the
instance. This way nova will not be able to enforce
an incorrect power state on the physical instance during
the periodic "sync_power_states" task.

Implements blueprint nova-support-instance-power-update
Story: 2004969
Task: 29423

Change-Id: I2b292050cc3ce5ef625659f5a1fe56bb76072496
